Reviews.Title: “superb staff”
Reviews.Author: MADEROSS
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is excellent, within walking distance of almost everything. The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming, making it a very nice stay for my wife and me. as Venezia-first-timer I forgot the umbrella: the hotel will give you one. only (neglectable) downside: hotel rooms are very, very small, so don't bring more than one suitcase, it won't fit. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Cliff325
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice, found the hotel easily from the Vaporetti, we were able to walk to Rialto bridge, St Marks Square and the station easily, also enjoyed exploring the quieter 'streets' behind the hotel, real Venice. Helpful reception staff, lovely breakfast and comfortable room, oldy worldy style not everyones cup of tea. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room 309”
Reviews.Author: pokerpolly
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from Venice and we booked at this hotel from late rooms and we asked for a superior room well very disappointed with the cupboard they gave us... the attic room with no windows just a small vulux roof window nothing like the photos on the web site!!! . A small flight of stairs went up to a small sitting room with terrace that over looked the roof tops which we never used except to put our suitcases in as the room could not fit in our luggauge. we had no hot water on 2 days in the shower. I wanted to ask to be moved but my other half being English just said leave it. The electricity box hummed very loudly and we had to take the key out at night so we could sleep.the hotel was clean and the breakfast lovely. The hotel was easy to get to from the airport very over priced for the room we had.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mkelly1953
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we had hoped for- old world charm but spotlessly clean (and quiet) room, great breakfast, ideal location and very helpful staff. When we mentioned that our booking included a free bottle of wine it was delivered to our door within minutes. As first time visitors to Venice we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “historic touch”
Reviews.Author: OlgaSergienko
Reviews.Content: This is an rather impressive old style hotel with nice and friendly staff and oppulent interiors. This is exactly what you want in Venice to feel the atmosphere of the city. There's an outdoor rooftop restaurant and views are magnificent. Very good offer for its price and a good reputation - the hotel is widely known in Italy and abroad. There is a nice little wine bar to the right when you leave the hotel, just across the road

Reviews.Title: “divine venice via giorgione hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teresa M
Reviews.Content: although we were in venice in feb '03, the hotel giorgione made our romantic stay most memorable. the ambiance was relaxing, and the staff was so friendly. we peruse the website periodicially, hoping to return soon within the next few years. the breakfast was delicious, and having a usa today newspaper was a bonus. the hotel is magnificent, and the room was decorated beautifully. we stayed 4 nights, and we had easy access to many of the sites within walking distance. the hotel is quiet, and the vaporrato boats are close by. the staff answered all of our questions. one criticism, if the hotel allows smoking, i would change all of it to non-smoking. we look forward to returning soon...thx again, teresa, from portland, oregon, u.s.a.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: OlaMayer
Reviews.Content: Very charming small hotel in the heart of Venice. Walking distance for every where. The only thing I would recommend to avoid are the 2 level rooms. The heat goes up and it is unbearable to sleep there even in the middle of the winter

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline237
Reviews.Content: This wxas our 6Th stay in Venise and first time at the Giorgione Hotel. The location is very good, all walking distance and quiet. The service was really very good and some people at the reception just charming and very helpfull. Breakfast is good and we shall surely come back!!! Jacqueline from Paris

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: EssexGirllala
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 5 minutes from a Vaporetta (water bus) stop on the Grand Canal, with plenty of shops, bars and restaurants nearby. It is also within easy walking distance (5-10 minutes) of the Rialto area and St Mark's Square. The reception area and lounge is very grand with several Murano glass chandeliers, comfortable chairs and free WiFi. The reception staff (Italian) were extremely friendly and spoke good English and French (possibly other languages). Breakfast was lovely: plentiful with hot, cold, savoury and sweet items to suit all tastes. In the afternoon free tea and coffee is served in the lounge, and if you fancy a cake with it, there are bakeries less than 3 minutes away selling delicious cakes and biscuits. Our room was comfortable with sufficient drawer and wardrobe space, free safe and adjustable heating. The bathroom had both bath and shower and decent smellies. The sheets and towels were changed every day. My only small complaint is that our room was too warm, but we opened the shutters to cool things down. Our view was of the internal garden area where I believe they serve breakfast in the summer. It looked very nice. When I return to Venice this hotel will be top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a trip to Venice, and we were really happy with our choice. The hotel is affordable and in a great location - easy to walk to the train station as well as to all of the great sights and water taxi stops. The staff is amazing - the front desk attendant must have spoken at least 4 languages, which was really impressive and useful. There are great, free breakfasts each morning and an afternoon tea each day. I loved the room, too - ours had an awesome exposed wood beam ceiling. It was beautiful! If you're headed to Venice and want to stay somewhere great, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Good price quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: squizz20
Reviews.Content: Old traditional hotel, ten minutes walk from the hospital and half an hour from the train station. Very friendly staff at the reception. Room was clean, though full of carpet. The building is old and so was the bathroom, there was no shower curtain. Beauty products we minimal but sufficient. Sleeping quality good, although the bed was a bit short. Temperature regulation in the room fine and adjustable. The minibar in the room was well filled with good prices. Breakfast was nice with fresh products and choice between american coffee or freshly sved cappuccino or italian coffee. Considering the price i would reccomend this hotel as it has a decent. It doesn't have a lot of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: jferemerson
Reviews.Content: Once you find this hotel, you'll be very pleased. The lobby features a beautiful Murano chandelier, along with a parlor where tea is served every afternoon. The rooms are quaint and clean, and we enjoyed a window with a flower box overlooking a quiet street. Complimentary breakfasts were wonderful. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge and San Marcos Square. There were plenty of shops, bakeries and restaurants nearby. The staff was warm and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Giorgione”
Reviews.Author: UllanlinnaTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful place to stay in Venice. The place and the rooms are unique and the service is very good. Short walk (5 mins) from Fondamente Nove, where you can easily get a boat to and from Venice Marco Polo airport. There is no wifi in the rooms though and this is the only complaint, really. Must recommend restaurant Paradiso Perduto at Fondamenta de la Misericordia quite nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: loverofmilan
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at the Giorgione Hotel in November 2011 for business purposes. I had a double room for single use. It was clean, spacious and quiet. View overlooking the swimming pool. Mini bar, flat screen T.V., double basins in bathroom, large entrance and comfortable bed. The breakfast was good, and the staff pleassant and courteous....pity about the canned fruit. The location is amazing.....will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anne952
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Giorgione for 4 nights last week. The rooms were clean and comfortable and nicely decorated. The bed linen and towels were changed every day. The breakfast was good with a good selection of hot and cold dishes, although the breakfast room staff were a bit dour. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. There was tea, coffee and biscuits served in the lounge every afternoon which was nice to come back to after being out all day. The hotel's location was excellent. It was in a quiet area with only a short walk to Rialto and St Marks Square, and very convenient for the vaporetto stops both at Fondamente Nuove and Ca'D'Oro. There was a nice courtyard which would be good to sit in and have breakfast in in summer time. The hotel also had a well-stocked bar. There were some very reasonably priced restaurants nearby. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel if I was in Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel but ......”
Reviews.Author: sidj6
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, off the beaten track and still central to most of the places. We like walking so a 20 minutes walk to Piazza S. Marco was fine. Rooms and hotel are very clean and well kept with the breakfast being very good. However, when we asked the Reception what is the nearest Pizzeria and a takeaway would do as well. The answer we got was that there's a restaurant nearby and the hotel's. Both of which were very expensive ! The one we went to was quite expensive. The next evening we found a reasonable restaurant(reasonable in Venice terms!) like 2 minutes walk from the front door of the Hotel. We felt let down by the Hotel's Recommendation as they directed us to a restaurant which was obviously not what we were after but obviously the restaurant serves the Hotel Staff well at least.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Angus4
Reviews.Content: My sister, who is a frequent visitor to Venice, recommended this hotel to us as a romantic, convenient place to stay. We agree with her wholeheartedly. The hotel is beautifully decorated, oozing with charm, clean, with a wonderful breakfast buffet and a lovely dining room. Our bed was in a loft which gave our room an airy, spacious feel. The neighborhood is quiet but close to the Rialto area and a glorious walk to most tourist attractions in Venice. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. You need to go to the lobby to use the internet though.

Reviews.Title: “Family owned hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: I'd be happy to reccomend this hotel to anyone travelling to Venice because it was comfortable, affordable, well sited just a few minutes from the Rialto Bridge and staffed by friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast buffet was the best I've found in many visits to Italy and their afternoon tea/coffee, available in the lounge every afternoon at no charge, gave us a great opportunity to network with other guests. I wasn't very impressed by the Internet access but there is a connection in the booth by Reception. Several guests had to use their laptops in the lounge for best wireless reception. Venice is quite a difficult place to reach if you have luggage. I'd reccomend a boat trip on the Vaporetto either to Ca' d'Oro or direct from Marco Polo airport to Fondamente Nove, which is just a few minites walk from the hotel. The location is just a few minutes from the Rialto and St. Mark's Square and the vaperetto for Murano/Burano also leaves from Fondamente Nove. Couldn't be easier.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gregfew
Reviews.Content: The best part about Giorgione is its location...close to Rialto and San Marcos, but just tucked away enough to be quiet and peaceful. The immediate neighborhood has great shops and restaurants, and you are literally 2 minutes from bigger crowds and more activity. The staff were extremely nice and helpful. The lobby and courtyard were both beautfiul. Our room was a bit of a disappointment...the room smelled musty and the shower was tiny...but it's Venice, and we spent little time in the room anyway. We would stay here again without hesitation, but with so many options in Venice, would look at other alternatives as well.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: JustWanderingAround
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, easy walk to everywhere in particular the grand canal, vaporetto, Rialto, but nice and quiet at the hotel itself. If the weather is dry you eat your breakfast in a beautiful courtyard. All the staff from manager to barman to cleaner were friendly, helpful and could not have done more for us. Room, lounge, dining area very well maintained and spotlessly clean. Good choice of food at breakfast. I understand the manager and his family actually own the hotel and think that showed through. Recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “So romantisch wie Venedig”
Reviews.Author: hedokola
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is fantastic. Only two stops with a Vaporetto from the airport, 5 minutes from the Rialto bridge, but a street away from the route where the masses of tourists walk. Right around the corner is a very cute wine bar, above all local go there. Breakfast can be taken in the inner courtyard, very romantic with vines, candles, a small fountain, sparrow flying in the courtyard as pidgeon on St Marc Square. If you prefer to sit inside, tables are set in white linnen and chair covers. Breakfast is served as buffet, including eggs and something like saussage or bacon. For Italy, the variety is great as usually they only drink cappuchino and eat a few cakes / cookies. The bar is open until 12 at night. The barman is fantastic and very nice and flexible. Reception is very nice, a bit stiff. :) The room are very clean, furnitured with antique furniture. For Venice, rather big as space is something that you will not find in Venice. I can only recommend the hotel. The only thing I noticed that in the mornings you hear kids playing, there must be a school or a kindergarden right behind it. Previous reviews mentioned it too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nazdem
Reviews.Content: Location was great, service was good, rooms abit ancient but feels special. I would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pam F
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 4 nights at this beautiful hotel. Very helpful, friendly, English-speaking staff at Reception. Clean comfortable room opening onto picturesque terrace with fountain. Excellent breakfast with good selection of food. Very central location - near to St. Marks Square, Rialto Bridge and boats to the islands. Water taxi dropped us one minute walk from hotel. Safe and hair dryer in room. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and will recommend it to others. Only downside was the long wait for hot water in shower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice "Old World" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giorgione in September 2011. Our room was on the first floor opening onto the inner courtyard. Overall impression of the hotel was very good. The room was clean but very small compared to US hotels. There is a safe in the room as well as hair dryers in the bathroom, but no shower curtain, not a big problem for us since we didn't have to clean it. They had free WI-FI in the lobby and bar. The hotel location is good with a grocery store & convenience store just around the corner and many restaurants nearby. You can walk to all the attractions. The Rialto Bridge is a short walk, and there is a water bus stop close by. We bought a 3 day water bus pass at the train station which I'd highly recommend since you'll be riding the water bus a lot. The hotel staff were very helpful with directions and recommendations, a must in the old city of Venice. The American breakfast was very good, however the bacon was very undercooked, almost raw. The breakfast room and the courtyard were great. One thing we found in all the Italian hotels on this trip â€“ the mattresses are uncomfortable. That being said, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel choice for vacation”
Reviews.Author: jmd1701
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in September. Highlights: beautiful lobby; very helpful and friendly staff; great breakfast (with a few hot dishes); beautiful outdoor courtyard for meals and drinks; reasonable rates; free WiFi. Pool table and bar in lobby. Downside: rooms are small; hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from nearest vaporetta station, and directions given by the hotel were so vague as to useless in the challenging streets of Venice. This was a problem when we arrived late and with luggage. Location is quiet, as it is 1-2 blocks off the nearest square. About a 10-15 minute walk to St. Mark's square.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: OZYGIRLAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Fantastic from the old world gentlemen charm, very comfortable clean rooms, nice breakfast and fantastic location for all that Venice has to offer. Very happy with our experience while at Hotel Giorgione.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: RichieUT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 3 nights during our honeymoon and couldn't have asked for a nicer place. The rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful in providing directions and recommending/making reservations for restaurants. There is complimentary tea in the afternoons and during the evenings they have a nice quiet courtyard to sit in with your drinks from the bar. The area that the hotel is in is quiet in the evenings but still has several dining options close by. The 2 nearest vaparetto stops are about a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel which can get you to any part of Venice or to the other islands depending on which stop you go to. If you take a water taxi then it can let you off at a different canal stop which is only about a 2 minute walk to get to the hotel. We will definitely be staying here the next time we are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Experience- this hotel has it all!”
Reviews.Author: jmcoe
Reviews.Content: My 83 year old mother has dreamed of going to Venice. Having been before, I knew that a good hotel would be essential to her enjoying this beautiful city. Boy, did we luck out when we found the Giorgione! The hotel is exactly what you dream of-- all the charms of old world Venice with the comforts of current day-- air conditioning, technology, and best of all- a FANTASTIC STAFF! These people go all the way to ensure guests have a great stay. Our room was fantastic-- located right off of a beautiful courtyard with a fountain, flowers, and little birds-- the perfect place to enjoy breakfast or relax in after a day of sightseeing. The hotel is very quiet- we didn't hear a sound at night. The breakfast room is beautiful-- and the selection of food is wonderful. The hotel is located off of a wonderful square where there are restaurants, trees, and benches to sit and enjoy the atmosphere. It was the perfect balance of access to the waterbus, and tourist sights while also being out of the crowds. There are some great places nearby to get meals, gelato, and a glass of wine. Around the corner is a coop grocery store. The direct waterbus to murano and burano was just a few blocks behind the hotel-- saving a lot of time. We really felt like we were able to experience the "true venice" while staying at the Giorgione. Having stayed in other hotels in venice, i HIGHLY recommend the Giorgione.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amy O
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Venice, I immediately called the hotel. The receptionists were very helpful on directing me on how to get to the hotel. Their personalities and friendliness each day made staying there enjoyable. The hotel itself is gorgeous! It has a huge sitting area for reading the newspaper or a book. There is the beautiful patio with a fountain and greenery that you can enjoy eating out on. The continential breakfast was nicely displayed and tasted great! The room included a bathtub, which I did not have at any of the other hotels I stayed at while in Italy. The bed was the most comfortable .And, I enjoyed the free internet access. I would definitely recommend this hotel and look foreward to staying there again when I'm back in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Ask For More!!”
Reviews.Author: tinafrost20
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing holiday staying at this hotel. It was off the beaten track so nice and peaceful but within walking distance of rialto bridge. The hotel was lovely and the room was very nice, overlooking the terrace. The food was also very good and the staff were great. Many thanks for making our first trip to Venice a pleasurable exerpience and hopefully we will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just didn't like”
Reviews.Author: Patch2522
Reviews.Content: I just didn't like this place. The shower was really tiny and the air conditioner did not work too well. They pushed 2 twins together to make a double bed (we were aware this could happen). However they do offer free wifi in the common areas. The front desk people were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EHoneyman
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a brilliant location. Away from the hustle and bustle but an easy walk to both Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square. The garden terrace was lovely for both breakfast and evening drinks. Great staff who are always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “I got what I came for-a place to reflect and look forward.”
Reviews.Author: jhmmt
Reviews.Content: I lost my wife in January and needed a place I had never been before to look back and forward at the same time. There is no place better to reflect than Venice in my book. This hotel provided a place for me to do that. Agood start with the typical Italian breakfast that my wife treasured on other Italian visits: delicious brewed ice tea (with ice) and biscuits in the aftrnoon to break the 5 o'clock heat. Little things like that: beautiful tile and shiny bright fixtures in the bathroom. Great places to sit and reflect inside and outside, off the beaten track just the right amount, still close to everything. I am into authentic, and that is what I found. Room keys I had never seen the likes of before, pool table, a small bar staffed all evening, things like that made me feel I was getting a good taste of big history.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: almccrae
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was good, close to water transport, good shopping and lovely restaurants. Hotel staff are very well trained, especially at the front desk where the check in and reception staff are efficient and knowledgable with a very friendly disposition. Highly recommended and will definitely return to the Hotel Giorgione.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AHSCapeTown
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean, neat hotel with a great location!! Close to transport and attractions. We really had a lovely stay. The one disappointment was that the air-conditioners in the rooms didn't work very well. We visited in summer and the heat was unbearable!!!! The other let down was that the Wi-fi was only available in common areas. The hotel served a wonderful breakfast!! I highly recommend this hotel if you visit Venice!!! I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: nekeyah
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quite old world but clean and efficient with interesting decoration. Our room was quiet and overlooked a courtyard. We got our internet to work in the room, although they said it was only meant to work in the lobby. Staff was friendly and helpful. Easy walking distance to ferry wharf. Breakfast was good. Our room service hot water for tea tasted fishy, but I think this may be a Venice problem rahter than the fault of the hotel. I did not particularly like Venice, as it was an overcrowded tourist trap with high prices, but I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spacious room, with friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Late_Harvest
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Giorgione Hotel for 3 nights in early July. We found it to be a great hotel, and would definitely stay there again if we returned to Venice. The spacious, traditionally decorated hotel is located in a great area â€“ itâ€™s only about 20 minutes (at a leisurely pace) by foot to St. Markâ€™s Square, but youâ€™d never know because you lose track of time when passing by many great shops, restaurants and other attraction while on your way there. While it is located in a fairly busy area, the hotel is just off a main square, so there is no noise or bustling crowds at night. For Europe, our hotel room would be considered fairly large. It was tastefully decorated, clean, with air conditioning (very important for Veniceâ€™s humidity!) TV, and lots of closet/desk space. The bathroom was large, even for North American standards with a bathtub that included a shower with great water pressure. The buffet breakfast was great (have it in the outside courtyard) with your standard continental choices, as well as eggs, bacon and sliced meats. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We inquired about taking the train to Verona for a day trip, and the desk clerk even printed us a schedule, and gave us tips as to which station was the closest. TIP: If arriving by the water taxi from the airport, the taxi may not stop at the Ca dâ€™Oro stop (it stops at Rialto). If this is the case, please pay the 6.50 Euros to then take the Vaporetto (water bus) the one extra stop to the Ca dâ€™Oro stop! Venice is a city with many, many mini foot bridges, all with steps. If you get off with your luggage at Ca dâ€™Oro, itâ€™s a short, flat distance to the hotel. While Rialto stop is close distance-wise, youâ€™ll be dragging your luggage up and down the steps of many foot bridges on the way to the hotel. Buy your tickets for all at the airport. A wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great place just a few hitches!”
Reviews.Author: EssexBeware
Reviews.Content: when we arrived at the hotel, staff were very nice and immediatly showed us to our room, on first impression it looked very nice, it was a two storey room decorated in typical venetian style, there was one small window with no views and the downstairs had a settee,television and fridge the bathroom was very close to the bed and a tiny built in wardrobe and no drawers, we stayed 1 night in the room and both felt a bit chlostaphobic and the stairs were very close to the bed, we requested to be moved into another room the next day as we did not like the layout as it felt quite 'pokey' the other room was lovely, spacious and airey with two bathrooms and not next to the bed. breakfast was ok, however seemed to cater more for the europeans cakes, pastries cold meat, only hot food was scrambled eggs and chopped bacon,very clean and hospitable service, food was much better in the local restaurants although a bit expensive, remember to ask for the set menu for lunch very good quality and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but quite expensive”
Reviews.Author: mFeatherst1
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night, so perhaps not enough time to really judge. My impressions are these. It was rather like an old dowager of a hotel whose best days are behind it. The staff was variable. Some quite gracious, some not so much. The restaurant was mediocre at best, but we only ate there for breakfast. The location was good, particularly for leaving for the airport as it was an easy walk - even with luggage to the airport boat. The room was very clean as was the bathroom. Our room had a loft for a bedroom and we both had to climb a very step stairway to get up and down. Dangerous for an old-timer like me. Especially in the middle of the night. All things considered it was far too expensive for the overall quality.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but Central Area”
Reviews.Author: sprager86
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay in Venice on our honeymoon. It was so peaceful, especially out on the balcony. There's no canal, not much of a view in this area, but its a nice place. There is a pool table, a large sitting area, a bar, a courtyard, etc. on the ground floor. It was pretty easy to reach from the airport. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hmoocarme
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay was good. The junior members of staff were very attentive and hard working. Although the room was nice and appropriate for its period, it was on the ground floor with no view of anything. However, If you do not mind that it is an excellent location to stay and visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente”
Reviews.Author: Bawgreen
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Great room Phenomenal service Complimentary breakfast was super. Tea and biscuits in the afternoon. 5-10 min walk to Rialto bridge. Additional 5-10 min walk to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DayTripperLDN
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at Hotel Giorgione and it confirmed my first (good) impression. The Hotel is well located near to Ca' D'Oro Vaporetto and central but away from the millions of tourists that flock around Pza San Marco or Rialto. Rooms are clean, decor is venetian style but they can be small-ish so better to ask the ones with king-size bed as they are bigger. The internal patio with the fountain where they serve breakfast is lovely The staff is very friendly and helpful however during my first visit I was supervised that the Concierge had very little information on the Venice Film Festival, which was the main event in September. Anyway, I will definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of Venice”
Reviews.Author: armchair
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel. It was charming, clean, and in a lovely area away from St. Mark's, but just a 10 minute walk from the action. The staff was courteous and helpful and the decor and amenities were better than expected. We were treated to a slice of local Venice life and impromptu music and singing at the Campo SS. Apostoli. Overall, a good value for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel, very friendly staff and attractive building”
Reviews.Author: winnersmum
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was booked for us by Railbookers and was easy to reach from the station. It is a very attractive building in a quiet but interesting part of this magnificent city. Our welcome was warm and friendly and having requested a quiet room we were given one opening straight on to the large inner courtyard/garden. The bedroom was decorated in a traditional style to suit the building, with pretty glass light fittings, and the bathroom was large with a wet shower area (no bath). We were aware of occasional brief noises during the night, possibly from the plumbing, but nothing that really disturbed our sleep. We ate breakfast in the courtyard, which has a fountain (turned on at 8.45am) and beautiful jasmine plants. A pretty good choice of food although limited fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “A gem tucked away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: SantaCruz93
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay while in Venice. It is in a quiet location near places we wanted to visit. The staff was very responsive to all requests. Breakfast was more than ample and beautifully served. Tea/coffee in the afternoon and newspapers in multiple languages were pluses. Restaurant Giorgione is nearby but separately managed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: rockgoddess309
Reviews.Content: Positives: 1) The staff was extremely friendly and helpful- by far the best during our entire stay in Italy! 2) Good location- easy to find and within walking distance of most everything in Venice. 3) The breakfast selections were great! 4) Very nice lobby and outside seating area. Negatives: 1) The rooms were small, and made even smaller by an additional table and 2 chairs. 2) The bathroom door hit the toilet, making it hard to maneuver in the bathroom. And although there is a tub and shower, there is no shower curtain or glass doors. Therefore, water goes EVERYWHERE. 3) No air conditioning, which isn't a huge problem normally. However, we were on the first floor and our window opened up to a busy restaurant. In order to sleep, we had to close the windows, which enabled no circulation or cool air. 4) Not a big deal, but we couldn't get the TV to work. However, since we were gone except at night, we didn't even bother mentioning it to the staff, as I am certain they would have fixed it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: macmue
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giorgione was a great stay in Venice. The room was classic and we enjoyed the old-time feel to this hotel. The breakfast was amazing! The best we had during our trip. The staff was very accomodating. An easy walk from the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a find”
Reviews.Author: Umac00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giorgione 5 years ago for our Silver wedding anniversary and thought it was a fantastic hotel, so when we were deciding where to go for our 30th, there was only one choice. We were not disappointed and had another fabulous trip to Venice. We were welcomed back like old friends and the staff can not do enough to help. Perfect location, down a quiet street not far from the Strada Nuova and within 5-10 minutes walk from all the sights. The Rialto bridge is about 3 minutes walk away. Both the rooms we have stayed in looked just like they do on the website. Good size especially in venice and very clean. Decoration and furnishings perfect. The breakfast is plentiful and with lots of choice. All in all, an excellent hotel for a short break in this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel by Venice standards”
Reviews.Author: 17clarence
Reviews.Content: All in all a very good hotel, though as pointed out elsewhere, feels more 3*** superior than the full blown 4****. Great location, though will take you 30 minutes to get to if you decide to walk from Piazzale Roma. 5 minutes away is a gondola stop you can use to cross the Grand Canal, and only 50 cents per person. Staff were absolutely perfect, breakfast very good for Venice, good for Italy, you certainly will not go hungry. Our room, an Elegance I believe, was large and bright with plenty of storage, decent bathroom with good lighting and twin sinks. Window over looking side alley. We ate in the adjoining Osteria and were very happy. Round the back of the hotel is Pizzeria La Perle, with excellent pizzas, good prices and even the house red was palatable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff that makes you feel very welcomed”
Reviews.Author: luvto quilt
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th visit to Venice and by far my favorite Hotel in Venice to date. The room was comfortable and roomy with a large bathroom w/tub. Breakfast was absolutely wonderful with a lot of choices. Eggs, ham, fruit, cereal, rolls were delicious. I can go on and on about it. I loved the lounge and 2:00 o'clock tea or coffee with cookies. Free WiFi was also a plus. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We only had reservations for 3 nights. They were able to get the 4th night for us at the same rate. I would like to explain my rating. Location: My Husband and I like the Canereggio area. It not as crowd as S.Marco. I only gave sleep quality a 4 only because I like a softer mattress and Italy doesn't do soft mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Venetian charmer!”
Reviews.Author: piper243
Reviews.Content: This place is the best! This was the second time I've stayed here - the first was in 1998 so I was a bit hesitant whether or not things would be as great seeing that it had been over 10 years. It was perfect! My husband and I stayed there shortly while on a 2 week European vacation and this was by far one of our favorite places that we stayed! It has the beautiful old world charm of Venice but is also very clean and the rooms are actually spacious for European standards. It's definitely tucked away, but it only adds to the charm of the place and it is still not a far walk from Piazza San Marco. The staff was amazing...they were there for all of our needs, as well as some great conversation! We felt like we had friends in Venice while we were there...couldn't have asked for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: mennogr
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and the room was very comfortable and clean. The atmosphere in the hotel was friendly and nice and the reception staff was always friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bogeyman50
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Italy celebrating my wife's 50th birthday. We traveled to many cities and have to say that our stay at the Hotel Giorgione was defiinitely one of our highlights. Our room was just beautiful. It had a large bedroom and a smaller sittiing room which was perfect for our 11 year old son. The bathroom was splendid, with marble sink and shower in a stunning pattern. Since we had a corner room, we were fortunate to have one view of the pool and courtyard, and the other of the quiet alley to the side of the hotel. We were basically winging it on the trip and were fortunate to book on-line just 2 days before we got there. We also added one more night to our stay because we loved it so much. Our concierge, Anna also helped us arrange other items for us, such as booking a hotel in Florence, (at Hotel called "Relais Uffizi" another recommended place) and helped deal with a rental car issue. Other perks were the free internet service (we didn't bring a lap-top) and the billiard room. The free continental breakfast was also quite nice. Since the hotel was not on the beaten path, it was very quiet. It was also located just a quick walk to the water taxi station (Ca' d Oro) and a 10 minutes from Piazza de S. Marco. The only item I could remove 1/2 star for was the shower. It never got hot enough for me and the water pressure was a bit low for my standards. Still, it wouldn't be a big enough issue for me to not stay there on our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Your Central Venice Value”
Reviews.Author: guavaman
Reviews.Content: Beware: This is not short! We spent 3 wonderful nights here in November 2010. Here for a cruise(and also a group of 15 other travel agents) that left from Venice. I had been here several times previously, my girlfriend though first time to Italy. I wanted a location centrally located and near the main attractions. Although I had visited several times before, those were all day trips as I had been assigned nearby while serving in the military. So I had familiarization of the city and wanted to showcase this awesome city to my girlfriend. With that I knew that I wanted to stay in one of the Cannaregio, Santa Croce, San Polo, or Dorsoduro areas in that order. My criteria was to find a reasonable price with GREAT location, Hotel Giorgione has that. We were about a 10 minute walk from the Rialto Bridge and San Marco another 3-5 minutes past that. Access from the north side to get to Murano, Burano, and Torcelo was also about a 10 minute walk to 2 different Vaporetto lines(instead of having to go all the way back around to the Grand Canal). Then close enough to the Piazza Roma to not have to rush when we were headed to the cruise port. Great food nearby, several grocery stores and Strada Nova is one of the main roads of Venice. Upon arrival, we bought a 3 day vaporetto pass at the airport(it also includes the bus fare too!) because we had an agenda that included LOTS of pictures. Took the bus to Piazzale Roma, crossed the bridge and boarded the Vaporetto to stop Ca D'Oro. We arrived during HIGH WATER, but since the government is aware of it, they place platforms in these areas to facilitate foot travel in these affected areas. From the stop to the hotel is about a 5 minute leisurely walk. Exit the vaporetto walk down the alley, make a right turn(now on Strada Nova) then walk until you get to the trees(and church) make a left and about 75 yards ahead is your hotel. We arrived in a light rain and Andrea with Margherita(her first day!) assisting, helped us in and made us feel comfortable. When you enter you first notice an amazing Murano blown glass chandelier, and a nice sized waiting area/lobby. We were checked in and my first impression is Andrea's command of the english language! Amazing he also fluently speaks 4 other languages besides Italian and English! He escorts us to our room and the bellman brings our luggage to our nice size room on the 3rd floor. Hotel bar downstairs, AWESOME breakfast buffet with pastries, meats, eggs, cereal, granola, breads, cheeses, fruits and veggies and several juices, milk, water, tea and coffee all available, some spread! A nice courtyard with pool and fountain greet you every morning for the buffet. Nice frescos on the walls, and art work is well placed throughout. Andrea and Margherita(we always seemed to run into them working due to our schedule) provided us with maps, directions to different locations, places to eat, and even confirmed reservations for us to visit the clock tower. It is really touching to have such awesome friendliness with heartfelt sincerity in a foreign country, much less in our own. Their restaurant is next door, but since we were quite spontaneous, we never got a chance to eat there. They were ALWAYS BOOKED AND FULL! So to try it there, make reservation ahead of time, I am sure it too is wonderful. I say if you are planning a trip to Venice, for the value, location and helpful hints from the staff, Hotel Giorgione is your place to stay! I will be booking my guests to Venice here at Hotel Giorgione!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed very much”
Reviews.Author: bjk1903Ankara
Reviews.Content: We were there for honeymoon holiday and managemnet prepared champaigne and nice gift for my wife.. room was upgraded for us and so comfortable,warm clean, breakfast was also good. thanks for everything..

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special = /”
Reviews.Author: HMatias
Reviews.Content: Nice breakfast, friendly staff and good location spoiled by my final bill where we discovered several drinks that we had not consumed from the frigobar being charged. Pointed to the staff who offered refund after we had already paid as the drinks where charged as a total and not described as it should be. We got a quite good room just above of the reception facing the street which was a bit noise sometimes. The room had nice decoration spoiled by watermarks under the windows and the flush from one of the toilets that when pressed would splash water from the toilet on the floor. However the room had two toilets and showers... the TV had a maximum sound volume which was a bit too little for my ears....Now funnily enough the bill situation happened after we have been in a situation where i saw one Italian guy buying one paint and paying 20 euros and when i asked the "artist" how much he was charging for the pictures he told me that the prices where by size and the same size that the Italian guy paid 20 he asked me for 30 euros... heard some more from other people while there in Venice about being charged different amount for the same things... so watch out for the ripping-offs.... good luck and have a nice time...

Reviews.Title: “Giorgione is a Venezia jewel”
Reviews.Author: DarbyDoolittle
Reviews.Content: I'll definitely stay at the Giorgione if I get to Venice again! It was easy to find from the Vaporetto (Ca D'Oro stop), even though we arrived on a rainy night. It was convenient walking distance to most anything (San Marco, Rialto, Vaporetto stops, etc). The hotel staff had superb customer service, especially Andrea our night desk clerk. He's fluent in 5 languages, so no worries. The breakfasts are wonderful, with a variety of choices of hot and cold items, including chocolate croissants that are delightful. There was plenty of fresh fruit, so there's something for all appetites. The hotel rooms have mini-refrigerators and there are a couple of small groceries nearby. Restaurants in Venice are pricey, often including charges just to sit. We bought cold cuts, breads, fruit, soft drinks and snacks so we could have modest meals...and save for a splurge dinner. There's a courtyard with tables/chairs, plus a large sitting area near the lobby, with clusters of couches/chairs/coffee tables so you can relax at the hotel outside the rooms. Our room was a little small...it is Europe...but with excellent amenities and extremely clean. Newspapers in multiple languages are provided in the downstairs seating area, and one common area computer is available for 30 minutes at a time. Tell Andrea we said hello!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: JamesHerbery
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. Perfect location to see the sights of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: luizaqueroga
Reviews.Content: At my first time in Venice, I booked this hotel for me and my mother. It was really nice, the best during our stay, we liked the decoration of the room, but it is not that new (what could be a bad point for other travelers, although we liked this). The hotel is well located, but like all hotels in Venice: it's hard to find and from out outside doesn't look good. Once you get inside it's amazing and beautiful, we loved the "patio" inside, with the sculpture, and the breakfast was really nice. I just don't say it was excellent, because there are hotels that can be better with the same price (which is not cheap... but this is Venice!).

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Venicemad
Reviews.Content: Having worked hard over the years to secure decent accommodation at a fair price in Venice..I have finally succeeded. That is IT ! Won't consider anywhere else. Ideally situated..amazing service and fabulous breakfast. ......home from home - Will book the hotel before the flight in future to ensure I'm not disappointed and exposed to the risk of disappointment which pervades so many of the hotels who profess to be 3star but which aren't.

Reviews.Title: “Italian Perfection”
Reviews.Author: jimbocnewyork_NY
Reviews.Content: Can we give this hotel 6 stars out of 5 ? Everything was perfect from check in to check out. The staff could not have been any nicer or more professional. Our standard room was more like a junior suite with a good sized sitting area downstairs and a bedroom upstairs. Breakfast offered a huge array of choices catering to every possible taste. The common areas are gorgeous where you can enjoy compimentary afternoon tea. And what a joy it was to come back to the room after a long day of sightseeing and find a complimentary bottle of prosecco waiting for us on ice! Check in and out was quick and efficient and done with a smile. All this for a very reasonable price. We cannot imagine a better value.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: sti_stage2
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel perfectly situated in the heart of Venice. My girlfriend and I, arrived in Venice via Eurorail and took the Actv bus-boat to Ca' D'oro, followed by a 5 minute walk to the hotel. It was extremely easy to find and we recommend the bus-boat over the water taxi, who was asking almost triple the price to shuttle us and our luggage to the same destination. The location was perfect, as the hotel was tucked away from the main pathway. It was a nice 15 minute stroll to get to Piazza San Marco and the Campanile. It was also close to Ponte di Rialto and many great restaurants. We were familiar with Venice and its many romantic streets within a day of exploring and fell in love with the Grand Canal. The hotel lobby was stunning. It was large and clean. They had complimentary home-made iced tea, lemonade, and tea biscuits upon arrival. There was a billiard table in the lobby and plenty of room to sit, along with an open bar to order wine and drinks. We were definitely happy with the backyard terrace with more outdoor seating where we could sip wine and relax during the evening. Breakfast was plentiful. There were hot foods including eggs and prosciutto, along with many other choices. Fresh fruit like watermelon was also a nice treat considering not many other hotels we had been to offered this. The only drawback to our stay was the size of our room. It was fairly small, with the bed taking up about 3/4. The padded walls made the room feel even more stuffy and claustrophobic. My girlfriend had a few coughing fits because of the stuffiness at night. It was hard to find room to place our luggage. There were however his/her sinks which was neat, though the shower was small. Another flaw were the poorly insulated windows. We were able to here people walking by up until 2am. Other than that the room was fairly clean and the housekeeping was good. We definitely don't have much more to complain about because Venice was such a beautiful city. Snaking through the romantic streets and watching the gondola's definitely made up for the small room. We have definitely fallen in love with Venice and hope to visit it again. Frulala was also 5 minutes away, which was our favourite fruit stand. All in all, we would recommend this hotel to all. We do agree with other Tripadvisor reviews - definitely book a suite, or larger room otherwise the standard room is really small.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelFun1800
Reviews.Content: This hotel has character. Its charming and full of antiques and glass chandeliers. The staff was very friendly and they were the only hotel to acknowledge our honeymoon by giving us a complimentary bottle of champagne and a Murano glass heart. Our room was small but very cute. The breakfast was substantial and a nice addition. They had toast, pastries, fruit, cheese, etc. The location was good for us because it was right near the boat to go to the airport and was about a 15-20 minute walk from the train station, but we made it with our luggage. The only complaint we really had was that the shower had no door or curtain and the shower head sprayed alot so water went everywhere! Im sure it was more inconvenient for the staff than for us :) I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, suspect rooms, your basic place to crash when exploring a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: mpetitti
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Giorgione was a mixed bag. On the one hand, the location was great, enabling easy walks to the Rialto Bridge and San Marco Square. A cozy wine bar is literally right next door as well, and down a small street is a lovely square where vendors set up shop and some of the few trees in Venice proper can be found. It only took us one full day to familiarize ourselves with the city and our immediate surroundings, and we soon felt right at home in the quaint, romantic town. The lobby areas in the hotel are well-kept (but beware the pics they display on their website - all our photoshopped and the colors are no where near as vibrant) and the daily breakfast was varied and delicious. The staff are extremely helpful and accommodating as well. I know the last point first hand as our initial room was an oversized closet. We literally had to climb over our suitcases to reach the bathroom. There were also stains on the walls and a few on the sheets. The next day I stopped by the front desk to voice my concerns and was pleased with a phone call later in the day from the manager offering us an upgrade. We immediately accepted and what a difference it made. The second room was over twice the size, spotless and altogether charming. Moral of the story: if you choose the Giorgione, be sure to book a suite. We were also treated to a complimentary bottle of champagne upon our arrival (it was our honeymoon) and thoroughly enjoyed the terrace just a flight down from our room and the lovely courtyard. All in all I would recommend the Hotel Giorgione to those looking for a Venetian hotel that's a few notches above average (but not exceptional) in a great location that won't knock your socks off but won't let you down either. (More on michael petitti dot com)

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Frau98
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a quiet location. well-located for the Rialto & San Marco. Old-fashioned service - very helpful staff. Able to leave cases before check-in & after check-out for as long as we wanted. Room was a bit on the small side & the sign saying you were not allowed to eat or drink anything in your room brought in from outside was a bit much. Overall a lovely place, though.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CgyTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: This is a great valued hotel in expensive Venice! We were upgraded to a small suite that had two bathrooms! Very clean, great buffet breakfast, free internet, a nice little bar and a beautiful little courtyard. The staff were very, very friendly and really helpful. The location is in a quiet area but just off a busy street that had many restaurants and is in walking distance to everything in Venice. Just a short walk as well to a Grand Canal ferry stop. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who does not want to stay, and spend alot, in the middle of busy, touristy Venice. But still Venice is a must see!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel near, but not in, the action”
Reviews.Author: EPLFan
Reviews.Content: Giorgione is a bit difficult to find but this could be said of a lot of things in Venice. Likewise, it is massively overpriced but, again, this is also true of all of Venice. It's a cute hotel with lovely courtyard to enjoy throughout the day. Breakfast is very nicely done and the wait staff work very, very hard to accomodate everyone's requests. In general, the staff is very courteous and helpful. The beds are pretty "firm" (hard), even by the standards of European hotels. The hotel is pretty easy to get around in and there are a number of restaurants nearby. The A/C is somewhat questionable, but this is true of many hotels in Italy and Europe. I'm not sure I would say the hotel is a "good value" but it's a great home base for get around in one of the world's most beautiful cities.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay at Hotel Giorgione. I would return here.”
Reviews.Author: mjpileggi
Reviews.Content: June 2010 I booked the Giorgione hotel after much research. La Calcina didn't have a room for me for all seven nights (read my review), so I booked Giorgione for my last two nights. This hotel was a nice upgrade from my past European hotels. Located off Campo Santi Apostoli, it's just a short walk from the Ca 'doro vaporetto stop (get off the boat, walk down the alley way, turn right on Strada Nuova and walk a few minutes, left at Sz. Pistor and the hotel is down one block on the right. The hotel map shows it on the left of the street. This area is a lot livelier than where I usually stay in the Dorsoduro area, but I enjoyed it. The lobby is lovely with a huge ornate Murano glass chandelier and is decorated in old Venetian style. There's a large reception desk and a telephone booth size internet "cafÃ©." It's free but you can pay a small fee if you want wifi access in your room. I was able to print out my boarding pass the night before I left. Also on the ground floor is a small bar, pool table room, and lovely dining room. Outside is a courtyard with tables, chairs, and umbrellas, and a fountain in the center of one area. It's a peaceful area. I sat outside one night talking to another guest while drinking my wine. The hotel has two elevators, which was a nice treat for me. Most budget hotels I stay in don't have an elevator, or if they do, there's still one flight up to get to it. To get to my room (#215, 130 euros per night), I had to zig-zag down the hallways to the back end. My single room was very nice and I was pleasantly surprised to see a full size bed. It had a corner headboard and was very comfortable. On the other side was a closet and dresser. On top of the mini bar was the tv. The bathroom was very small and it didn't have any counter space. If hotels got rid of the bidets, there would be room for a tall cabinet or at least more floor space. The lighting was great and the main wall over the sink area had a huge mirror. My room faced an inner court and it looked like the building across from me was an apartment, or at least not part of the hotel. The hotel serves a very nice breakfast with scrambled eggs, a few types of cured meats, cheese slices, fruit, yogurt, cereal, etc. Service was very friendly. The hotel has complimentary tea and cookies in the late afternoon, but I was never around to enjoy it. I enjoyed my stay at Giorgione and would stay here again. Grocery store and local wine shop: Go past the hotel one block and turn right (C.L. Proverbi). Go down one block and turn left (R.T. SS. Apostoli). On the left is a grocery store and on the right a few feet further is the wine shop, #4657. Bring your own empty water bottle and have it filled with inexpensive, local Italian wine).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: alisonh13
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were very happy with our stay at Hotel Giorgione. It was reasonably priced compared to some of the other hotels we looked at in Venice. However, be aware that the hotel has a wide range of rooms. if you pay more, the more upgraded rooms are much nicer. I stayed in a standard room for single use and it was clean but sparse and small. The bed wasn't very comfortable, but I've found that to be true for a lot of older hotels in Europe. My parents had the next higher level room and it was a good size and very elegant. The breakfast was good, the lobby and the patio are gorgeous. The hotel is less than a five minute walk from the Ca D'Oro vaporetto stop and an easy 10 minute walk away from St. Mark's square.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScotinEngland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was found easily from the website directions from the airport via water bus. The staff were attentive yet only when you needed help. The classic room was quite small but very comfortable. The receptionist was quite expert in helping us with advice as to how to get round Venice.. The hotel was in a quiet district of Venice with excellent food just around the corner for the evening out. Breakfast was ok but nothing out of the ordinary. The al-fresco breakfast in the the courtyard was delightful. A strong positive - recommended by our travel agent as a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deb31610
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff very helpful and friendly. The location was convenient. It was an easy walk to the Rialto Bridge or to the water bus (Vaperetto). The location is quiet at night. Minuses were that the room was a bit hot at night. Also the bathroom was not on the same level as the bed. This meant occassionally negotiating the stairs at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nocoffeee
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here the day after I proposed to her on a cruise. We loved this place. It's in a great location and is small and quiet. They have lemonade and tea during the day if you want to grab a drink -- in the summer a quick drink like this is priceless. The rooms are a bit old fashioned if you will. Not how I would decorate them but not major complaints. The bed was a bit stiff. Other than that we loved it. The hotel staff was aware we were checking out very early (430am) to catch the first water taxi to the airport and was there with food bags waiting for us. They also helped us book a reservation at a nearby restaurant that threw in free champagne for us (I assume courtesy of the hotel). Absolutely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad but Not Great”
Reviews.Author: gigilum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giorgione for a few days while we were in Venice. The location is not bad and the rooms are comfortable. The bathrooms were not great but they weren't filthy. The staff was also just ok, they weren't very enthusiastic about fulfilling requests but they didn't complain either. We got a great rate with the breakfast buffet included which made our stay here palatable. Buffet had a large selection of hot and cold foods and served in large room with adjoining terrace with a nice fountain. If you can get this place at a steal then it might be worth it since Venice can get very expensive. I recommend this place ONLY if you can get a good rate. DO NOT PAY RACK RATE or you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & nice staff - but doesn't feel like four stars”
Reviews.Author: Izabel_blue
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Giorgione was one of the most mixed hotel experiences we've had in nearly 10 years of travelling together. On the plus side, the Giorgione is in a great location - central enough to be within a 10 minute walk to the water bus, which allows you access to all the sights of Venice, and quiet enough so that you're away from the throngs of tourists and you can get a feeling for real Venetian life. The multi-lingual staff are also very sweet and accommodating, with lots of advice for your stay. However, this didn't feel quite like a real four-star hotel compared with other Italian four-star hotels we have stayed in - the attention to detail was lacking, and the hotel is crying out for refurbishment. For our first night, we stayed in a tiny, depressing standard room, with a minuscule bath-less bathroom and an overpowering smell of vegetable peelings! Given the other positive reviews here, we could simply have drawn the short straw, but avoid room 224 if you can. For the next two nights we upgraded (at some expense) to the only other available room - a junior suite (room 112), with tons of character (two levels, lots of room to sit, exposed beams on the ceiling), and a great improvement. Overall, the Giorgione really fell down on the little detail points - no boxes of tissues in the room, no body lotion, and no tea or coffee available any time other than at breakfast or between the hours of 2-5 in the afternoon. The hotel felt understaffed even when fully booked. The so-called 'bar' in the evening was an 'honesty bar' - a trolley filled with various bottles and mixers, from which you help yourself and submit your bill to reception. This is fine if you're after a glass of evening wine, but not great if you're in need of a hot drink after getting caught in one of Venice's many thunderstorms! All in all this is a charming, quirky hotel in a pleasant, sane location - and if that's what you're after, the Giorgione fits the bill (though make sure to book the highest room class you can afford). However, if you're after a bit of Italian 4-star luxury, you might consider other options first.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mgt1
Reviews.Content: The Giorgione is a quiet, family run hotel in an excellent position (just off the Strada Nova and between the Ca' d'Oro and Rialto Market waterbus stops on the Grand Canal). The staff speak excellent english, are freindly and keen to help. Within the hotel you will find antique furniture, floral patterns and Morano glass chandeliers in abundant supply - so if your personal taste edges towards the minimilist, you will find the decor quirky and eccentric. However, the rooms are a good size, spotlessly clean and our bed was huge and very comfortable. Apart from the church bells, which do not ring during the night, the hotel is very quiet and peaceful. Breakfast was good and the Croissants excellent -though you have to be quick to grab one as they vanished quickly. I would recommend the Giorgione for romantic couples (young and old) and, if you are staying in Venice for more than a day, buy a waterbus pass (available on-line) as this will save you a lot of money

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic”
Reviews.Author: dletch
Reviews.Content: Our stay there was unforgettable. It was romantic and precious.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem ...”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem in Venice. It's conveniently situated close to Fondamente Nuevo (on blue line boat from airport) or Ca d'Oro on Grand Canal. Our room was small but fine. In Venice you're not going to spend too much time in the room after all! Breakfast was a buffet and there was plenty of choice. Our rate included breakfast - booked through Hotels.com. The hotel also had free internet access if you used their laptop next to reception.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: lovestoshop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in November. The staff were all really lovely and very helpful. Unlike the other reviews, our room was on the small side. We had twin beds but there was no gap between them and not much room to walk around them but that's the luck of the draw. The room and bathroom were both clean but our room did not get made up on the second day while we were out. We also had issues with heating but luckily for us it was cold. The hotel is in a great location and we were able to walk from the train station, about 20 minutes lugging big suitcases. The hotel booked a water taxi for our trip to the airport at the end of our trip. The breakfast was quite ordinary. There is no wifi available at this hotel, the only internet is a laptop set up in a realy small phone booth next to reception. Overall a good stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “like a jewellery box”
Reviews.Author: hunsko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giorgione at the beginning of Nov2009. During the check-in the staff was professional, they were quick (anyway, I missed some small personal something) and then we have been shown our room: a beautiful room with authentic furniture. Flat TV, mini bar, convenient bathroom - all was perfect. Breakfast was just OK - good for one or two days, but if you stayed longer it could be boring. The hotel was easy-to-find, really just 80 m walks from Piazza SS.Apostoli - a very good location to discover Venezia by foot and vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cheekyrn1
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 days excellent location short walk to most tourist attractions very easy to navigate to important sights hotel was clean buffet breakfast very good staff was lovely with the exception of evening female desk clerk (do not know her name) hotel room was clean but incredibly warm hotel unable to resolve this

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: midwestgalOmaha
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel Oct. 12 and 13. This hotel is elegant and unique and we loved it. The location is great and it was in a quiet area. I would not stay in the San Marco area as it is always noisy and full of people and we spoke to some other American tourists who had issues sleeping at night due to noise in that district. We had a room on the courtyard and it had a king bed - the largest room and bath we had in Italy. The staff was wonderful and the breakfast was fabulous. I travel frequenly and would recommend this hotel because it was just a wonderful place to stay. It took us 5 minutes to walk to the Rialto Bridge and maybe 10 minutes to San Marco and some of the best cafes and restaurants are a few steps from the hotel. I hope tp return to Venice and would stay again at this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place with Excellent Service but you will pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: julened
Reviews.Content: Wow! Very nice hotel with an excellent breakfast. Super Staff! They knew me by name on the first night. The outdoor courtyard is beautiful and a great place to have a glass of wine in the early evening before diner. Great restaurant just down the street too. Met my expectations but was very expensive, but then again what isn't in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Principessa ( princess ) was my treatment at Albergo Giorgione.”
Reviews.Author: Bellalingua
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to find Hotel Giorgione by accident when I was planning my recent trip to Venezia. How fortuntate I did not really know until I starting to deal with Antonella ( booking ) and then upon arrival and my stay. From 4000 miles away, even with the internet, things can get difficult if the right person is not at the other end. I never had any such problems. I cannot say enough about her - she is a wonderful person! My vacation was made all the more wondeful because of her. Upon arrival ( a friend was with me for part of my stay ) we were greeted welcomingly, showed to our room forthwith, and luggage delivered before we even had a chance to look the beautiful room ( actually a suite ) over. Breakfast was wonderful and Alberto, Antonio and Donia - worked tirelessly to make certain everything was just so - there was much to choose from - I miss very much my cornella ( Italian cuissant ) and my cappuccino that Alberto brought to me without my asking after my first day. Everyone at the front desk - Gianni, Andrea, Leila, Anna, Lucio, Luigi, were a joy to see each day and ever patient and willing with whatever assistance I needed or simply to chat a few moments, as well as Anthony at the bar in the courtyard. The location - cannot be beat. Venice is really not as big as one thinks it is - distance on any map seems longer than the actual walk it takes to get from place to place. From the hotel it is a direct route to Rialto, San Marco, Accademia, Ferrovia - anyplace you need to go and it is quieter than San Marco and the streets that much bigger and very residential. I loved inhabiting in a place where the people who live inc this magnificant place, actually live. It is easy to get to from either Ca'Doro vaporetto stop or from Fondamente Nove - but I suggest taking the boat from the airport as it is a much more scenic route to go - you just have to walk a bit longer and over some bridges. If you come thru Ca'Doro - you first go thru Piazzale Roma by bus, then vaporetto and the walk to the hotel is shorter down the Strada Nova ( big wide street ) and no bridges to cross. It may not be on a canal - but one is a stones throw away and with my windows open I had the sounds of everyday Venetian life and the churchbells of SS Aposoli each day to wake me and to be there for me upon my return, I simply loved eveything about it! I have traveled many times over the years on my own and this is by far one of the best places I have ever stayed in terms of feeling connected to the people who worked there. I was there for 9 days, but no matter the length of my stay I have no doubt it my reaction would be the same. I will stay again upon my return and would suggest you do the same. I miss them all and Venezia more than you can know. Ciao! Buon Viaggio

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Venetian Treasure”
Reviews.Author: lilkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and found it really was a fantastic find. The location was perfect, being 5 min from the rialto bridge and close to lots of bars, restaurants and gondalas. The breakfast was varied by italian standards, with eggs, hot meats as well as the usual continental options. The hotel is decorated beautifully and we loved sitting out in the courtyard sipping the house bellinis they were gorgeous. The rooms were a good size and very clean if there was to be one small grumble it would be that there are no ironing facilities and when we asked for an iron were told that "these buildings are wooden, it would be a hazard" which confused us as there was no ban on hair straighteners ?? All in all a lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful and professionally run hotel”
Reviews.Author: beanzz08
Reviews.Content: Had the start of our holiday at Giorgione and the end ,so all in all we had 4 nights there,lovely outside breakfast area and lush food.Situated in centre of city and very convenient for getting around -helpful staff and they did their best to resolve a problem we had at the start of the holiday (noisewise) by giving us a lovely room at the end and really spoiing us.

Reviews.Title: “good for some, not others”
Reviews.Author: jimmshorts
Reviews.Content: The room was as promised; a two-story junior suite with a terrace affording views over Canneregio. Breakfasts and the coffee were wonderful. I liked it; I am an optimist. However, my travel companion found the airconditioning inadequate, as well as the neighborhood too far removed from "the true Venice". Que sera sera

Reviews.Title: “very fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: joshbn
Reviews.Content: reasonably sized and clean rooms. friendly staff. nice breakfast and tea on the garden. excellent AC. Easy access to both the touristy and not-so-touristy areas of venice. Casa Mia around the corner does a great pizza, one of the best in venice. billa supermarket very nearby. Though they still charge for internet access, the cost is quite reasonable. Our room was cool. Our shower did not spray all over the floor, a common problem with italian bathrooms. Very quiet at night, so no problems sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: aureliaNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff was excellent. The location was away from the crowds but walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsShortStayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel Giorgione in July. We found it by chance searching on a travel agent's site, and loved the pictures. The hotel is just as good as its website suggests. Our room was one of the cheaper ones, but had all that we would have wanted. Breakfast in the courtyard was wonderful, and there are plenty of places to sit and relax. Very close to the centre of Venice, and easy to get to from Marco Polo airport. Would definitely come back - but next time would like a roof-terraced room!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Slovak76
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to go Venice and my lovely fiancÃ© have arranged a trip to Venice on my birthday in January. He booked the hotel because my daughter has a similar name and the reviews were very good. The position of hotel is great as we stayed away from the hustle of central Venice and took a pleasure in a lovely stroll from St Marks square every night. The room was fabulous, beautiful venetian blue decor with a little sitting room and a sun terrace which we enjoyed even in winter. The breakfast was great and dinner was arranged with sister restaurant next door which was mouth watering even for my fiancÃ© who is very fussy where meals are concerned. Lastly, the staff was very friendly and always smiling and very polite. We have absolutely loved the three days in Venice and we loved the hotel so much that we are considering going back and get married there. Absolutely fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay at this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: John and Tony
Reviews.Content: The reviews written by fellow travellers in May 2009 sum it up perfectly. The fact that we came back (and will come back again) is testament to the quality of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Paris108
Reviews.Content: Giorgione Hotel was just lovely. It was our first place we stayed at in Italy and it was very special. It also was our most expensive (budget travelling) but was a great place to stay. Close to everything (Venice is not that big!) and the staff were very nice. Although our room was plain and comfortable the breakfast area/ afternoon tea room/sitting rooms etc were beautifully furnished and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mjzalord
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giorgione for two night in the middle of April. Hotel was clean and conveniently located. Service was very good and the breakfast was exceptional. This is definitely a hotel that I would stay at again. The only issue was that, although it was hot, the A/C was not turned on yet, so we needed to sleep with our windows open. Mosquitos were not terrible, but we did wake up with mosquitos in our room every morning. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient quiet location”
Reviews.Author: LEMYakima
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Giorgione and had a great experience. Venice is wonderful and easy to walk anywhere, even when getting lost in the numerous side streets. The Hotel is near the Rialto bridge, but far enough away so that it was very quiet at night. Our first night we slept close to 14 hours, albeit this was after our lengthy trip to get here, but we have never slept that long in many, many years. Breakfast was more than adequate and the coffee, both in the morning and afternoon were excellent. The rooms are fairly small, but typical for Europe. however they should invest in longer shower curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: kiwiinmtg
Reviews.Content: We found out about this hotel through the Lonely Planet Guide and booked our stay in venice through them. They were priced well for a four star establishment and we had a great time here. They even through in a bottle of Champange for us to celebrate our honeymoon! The room is uniquely decorated and they have a free tea and coffee service in the afternoon. We really enjoyed our stay here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Leedslass78
Reviews.Content: Ignore the last review. Clearly they had a bad experience and havent actually stayed in every hotel in Europe which they seem to suggest. Yes it is expensive. Thats the only reason it didnt get a 5 from me. As I understand it Venetian hotels are generally expensive - its a supply and demand thing. The public areas are excellent, the staff very helpful, our room was great. It was our first wedding anniversary and they had put a bottle of prosecco in there, nice touch. The room decor looked traditional venetian, as far as I could tell. Breakfast was above average, in a nice room. Location was excellent. 5 minute walk to the Rialto and 10 minutes to St Marks, yet in a quiet "off the beaten track street." Would stay here again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Rip-Off in Europe”
Reviews.Author: SmithUSA
Reviews.Content: When we called and asked for a double room, they told us that 220 euro was their best price and it included a tour to Murano. We gave them our credit card info and after we arrived and checked in to our TINY, LOUD all night room, we checked their website and the prices there were 50 euro cheaper. I asked for that rate and they told me that the rate was changed five minutes after we checked in.
