We then told them that we wanted to book the tour they acted like they didn't know what we were talking about. From that point on, the staff was very rude and unhelpful. Don't waste your money here, there are lots of better and cheaper places in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Hotel Giorgione in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CarpeNox
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights at the Hotel Giorgione in Venice with our married son and his wife. Everything about our stay exceeded our expectations, which had been set high. This was our daughter-in-law's first visit to Venice so we wanted everything to be perfect. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful, beginning even before our stay, when they arranged bookings at restaurants for us. Our room, on two levels, was very large, clean, quiet and comfortable. The hotel location made it easy for us to walk or take the vaporetto to all of the locations we wanted to visit. We will definitely return to the Hotel Giogione whenever we are next in Venice. La Serenissima is a magical place and the Giorgione enhanced our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Essex2008
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfiend stayed at the Giorgione in the Canneregio district after booking on Expedia. We got a great rate and was looking forward to our trip after reading other positive reviews on trip advisor! On arriving in Venice we got the water bus from the airport which normally costs 12euros and takes about 40minutes. Our hotel was a short 5-10 minute walk from the Fondamente Nove water bus stop, where the Airport bus dropped us off. On arrival at the hotel we were allowed to check in 2hours early - and we had been upgraded to a junior suite! The hotel was better than expected, and the pictures we had looked at previously didnt do it justice at all. It was very authentic and although the bathroom was on the small side, it did not compromise our enjoyment of the room! Tip - We bought the 3 day VeniceCard for our 4 day trip prior to travelling which cost around 50 euros and was well worth it - you get a return bus journey to and from the airport, and unlimited travel around Venice. This saves queing at bus stops each time you want a ticket and is a welcome rest for tired feet after walking around venice all day! Be warned though - the buses are much more crowded on a saturday and sunday, and especially the routes that go via St Marks and Rialto. If we went again we would definately get the venice card - well worth it! However, you dont need to stamp it everytime you use it - just the first time!! We ate at a lovely canal side restaurant called Ristorante da Raffaele (i think this is the correct spelling) in the San Marco district and it was a good price and excellent food especially for a canalside eaterie - these tend to be be overpriced for what you are getting - here we had 2 courses each and wine came to 110euro inc. service etc. If you are looking for a cheaper pizzeria meal that is good quality, try Ae Oche in the Santa Croce district - here 2 pizzas and mozzerela balls plus wine came to 35 euros inc service!! best Pizza we ever had! Ice Cream stalls are everywhere - we ate at one along the strada nova literally just round the corner from the hotel and it was fantastic would definately recommend!! The District that the hotel Giorgione is in is in a fantastic location - busy without being manic like the areas nearer Rialto and St Marks, and the hotel staff couldnt be more helpful. We asked them for help with our Gondola ride and they directed us to a Gondola stop 5 mins from the hotel and we got a good ride half on the Grand Canal and half on the smaller canals - 35mins for 90 euros, which is about average - we took our ride at 6.20pm so it was a bit cooler - the prices go up to 110 euros after 7pm! However only slight downside was going in August - our first day was 38 degrees!! Although it didnt spoil our holiday we would recommend going when its slightly cooler - thankfully the Giorgione had airconditioning! We had a fantastic stay here and would definately recommend this hotel, and we will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BroadyLeeds
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and clean with really nice decor and everyone was really friendly. The rooms can be on the small side but are so welcoming it doesn't really matter. We stayed for my best friends wedding which was amazing. I'd definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Is A True Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: batchelorette1
Reviews.Content: This place was an absolute delight! From the moment we came dragging our luggage toward the front door (after having scrambled on and off of a water bus on a hot day) the front desk staff was ready to serve. A uniformed bellman came outside to help me with my enormous suitcase! When we stepped inside, we knew we were in for a real treat. This hotel was decorated beautifully in rich reds and golds and greens. There is a very generous sitting area near the lobby as well as an absolutely beautiful sitting/eating area out back. There are glass chandeliers everywhere and an air of elegance wherever you look. My room was small, but lovely, and the bathroom was large, by European standards. They served iced tea and cookies every afternoon near the outdoor fountain, and the breakfast in the morning was fabulous! There were hot and cold selections, and the variety was really generous. Again, uniformed employees kept things replenished. We enjoyed our meal outdoors, but we also had the option of eating in the dining area indoors. There is a full-service bar near the lobby, too, so it was easy to have a nice glass of wine before heading out to dinner. The front desk was very helpful with maps and suggestions, too. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It was definitely the nicest accommodation of our entire two-week trip!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, Authentic and Pretty Venetian Treat - Go there!”
Reviews.Author: MonicaPatricia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a memorable trip to Venice and the Hotel Giorgione was the icing on the cake! Typically Venetian in all respects, the lounge, garden, fountain and dining room are especially fabulous with the pretty Murano glass chandeliers and lighting set in very plush surroundings. Our room was lovely - everything was spotlessly clean and as we requested before travelling. Rooms differ in size and colour but ours was a classic (standard) room with 6ft - king size - bed and green and gold theme throughout .The staff is fantastic - you are treated as family - nothing is too much trouble and they pay particular attention to every detail - the service was excellent. A gondola ride is a number one must do - if you ask at the Hotel they will book for you and direct you to the Campo di Sofia, off the Strada Nova - three/four minutes walk from the hotel. Here you will receive personal service - we paid 90 Euros, compared with 120-130 elsewhere. We had a sumptuous black and gold gondola, decorated with brass horses, hand-painted coat of arms and red carpet for the Gondolier, who took us through the pretty, smaller canals as well as the Grand Canal, and gave a very good commentary just for us two! It was a beautiful sunny day and wonderful photographic opportunity. Views from The Campanile in St Mark's Square is number two must do! Again, choose a clear sunny day if possible for those photos. Take an extra trip to St Mark's Square at night around 9.30 - 10pm and see the place all lit up with less crowds. Sit outside at Quadri with a cocktail and listen to their brilliant musicians. The night boat (every 20 mins) will take you back to Rialto for a five-minute, well lit walk back to the hotel. Eat near the Hotel Giorgione - plenty of good restaurants and cheaper than the Rialto and St Marco. Within a one minute walk from the hotel is the SS Apostoli square, with its old church, tall steeple and chiming clock. Here you can sit outdoors in the restaurant amongst the flowers and trees and enjoy a Prosecco (sparking dry white wine - ice cold!) any time of the day or evening and watch the world go by! Rialto Bridge is five minutes' easy walk from the Hotel Giorgione and St Marco square a further ten minutes. All in all a fabulous experience not to be missed. Hopefully one day we will return to Venice and the wonderful Hotel Giorgione - whom I congratulate on offering first class hospitality, food, service and surroundings Paul and Marian from Leicester, England - 2-5 June 2008

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Voyageur5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights on our Honeymoon. This charming hotel is a great representation of Venice and its spirit. It is located in a quiet area with great shops (many of the products sold in this area are the same as the ones sold downtown but are much LESS expensive) and restaurants and is within walking distance of every attraction. Our room was a junior suite with a private patio. The room is bigger than average for the area and it was cleaned every day. The staff was also helpful and polite. The breakfast was excellent and make sure to try the jelly croissants! There is seating inside or outside (there is also a nice seating area outside on a second level overlooking a decoration pool). There is iced tea and cookies served in the afternoon. The bar serves many drinks and a pool table is nearby. The lobby has a large seating area perfect for taking pictures. Internet access is also available. Make sure to see theatre, opera and definitely go on a Gondola ride (it is best at night as the canals are quiet). A guide book and a map will make your stay enjoyable as it will be easy to locate attractions. We used â€œTop 10 de Veniseâ€� which detailed all the main attractions spread over a 7 day stay. Dining in Venice is an experience all by itself. The flavors and the quality of the food will enchant you in all the areas of this great city! Pastas are simply delightful. We will definitely return to this hotel the next time we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to start our trip!”
Reviews.Author: skibill
Reviews.Content: We started our trip to Italia at this hotel. It was a great location. One of the front desk staff was quite helpful and one was not! The rooms were adequate size and nicely decorated. The bathroom also was fine. We did have transport to/from the airport arranged in advance by water taxi and that was worth the extra money since it was just my daughter and myself traveling. Venice can be a little confusing on first arrival so this was a nice luxury. People were very friendly all throughout and we allowed ourselves to get lost a bit which was very easy! We loved the quaintness and quiet of Burano (the lace making island) more than the busy, tourism of Murano (for glass). It was a lovely couple nights' stay.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: BAPTISTINE
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel, room nicely decorated and cosy. The staff is very helpfull, and the lounge a nice place to stay for a while. We also liked very much the situation, a little bit away from the most touristic parts of Venise, so that we could discover some more quiet places in the city ; the St Mark place is only 15 minutes walking though. The bad point were the bathroom, which looks old and sad, and of course the prices but it was Carnaval time !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: NarkedStarfish
Reviews.Content: This is definately worth splashing out on. Granted it's a little on the expensive side, but these days, everything is in Venice. A bit of Advice - Please don't go to Venice wanting a budget trip, you really won't have the best time possible. Go prepared to have a great time, wonderful food, lovely wine and spend a bit on what you want in a unique setting ! If you look around you can get this hotel at very reasonable rate considering what it's like. This is our second trip to Venice, and the Giorgione really is lovely, even the best hotels in Venice are small and have small rooms... just take a look around there isn't the space for anything too big, but the Giorgione really gives you an idea of what the grand houses of Venice might have been like. Friendly people and a great location. Less than 10 mins from Fondamente Nove (vaporetto & Alilaguna bus stop) or the Ca D'Oro on the Grand Canal, about 10 mins from the Rialto, about 15 mins from S.Mark Sq (if you don't get lost). From Marco Polo airport get the Alilaguna vaporetto bus it's a 10 min walk from the airport (signposted you really can't get lost) I can't imagine arriving in Venice any other way :) Buy tickets for this and the normal vaporetto (waterbuses) routes from one of the kiosks at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: stringman25
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is a short (5-10min.) water bus ride from the train station. It is located just off of the square where the bus stops. It is about 150 yards from the nearest canal so if you want to stay directly on the canal you shouldn't stay here. The lobby is very nicely decorated with several little rooms to sit in and relax. They have a small bar area and offer free afternoon tea in one of the rooms off the garden. Also included was a nice breakfast which had several hot menu items as well as the usual continental stuff. There are 3 good restaurants within a 1-2 minutes walk and the main walkway is just a few steps down the way. I would definitely suggest staying here to anyone as it is very clean, convenient, and moderately priced considering how nice it is.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in an excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: claire1912
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over easter 07. This was a lovely hotel, even though the room was very small. The buffet breakfast was good, but best of all the location is excellent and when you are on a city break i think that 's very important. I didn't rate this as a 5 because i think the rooms were a little on the small size and the hotel is more 3 star. But i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Georgione - Venician sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: SunnyinSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in October - the Hotel is definitely a sanctuary from the hustle & bustle of Venice. Yes, the room was small, but it was spotlessly clean, and the staff were very friendly, much friendlier than in Florence - the front desk staff even taught me how to ask for my room number in Italiano. They also directed us to the public boat to get to Murano, rather than pushing any service they might have been getting commission from - which surprised me after Florence. Breakfast was fine, great range of cheeses, meats and breads, great coffee and very friendly service, especially when I ordered a cappucino, rather than Cafe Americain...and since when is fruit salad a breakfast food anyway? When in Europe, eat European!

Reviews.Title: “Girogione - Secret little jewel”
Reviews.Author: BoCyn
Reviews.Content: This 4 star hotel is located in the Cannaregio district, a short walk from the Ca D'oro vaporetto stop. Located in a residential neighborhood, it is within an easy walk to the Rialto and St Marks square. We paid 205 euros for a standard room with two twin beds. The room was small but adequate for two nights. Next time I'd opt for a larger room. The building was a former confectionary warehouse and no two of the 76 rooms are alike. They had a nice buffet breakfast in the AM and afternoon tea in the garden. Free internet access. There are many restaurants in the area but be sure you have a reservation. The nice part about the hotel's location is there were no bridges or stairs to navigate with your luggage getting from the vaporetto stop to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sambucca45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. Although the stay was above average, it was a very poor value. The room [#206] was very small, even by European standards. This is not a 4 star hotel. It is conveniently located. The staff was professional and courteous. The breakfast buffet was good. I would not stay here again simply because I thought it was extremely overpriced. I relied on a Rick Steves recommendation. I think I could have found a better room at this price if I had done my own homework.

Reviews.Title: “A good 4-star choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: Venice hotel rates seem to fluctuate a lot, and I've found that a good way to track down a deal is to look at sites like kayak and sidestep and see who is offering a good deal for the nights you need. That's how I found the Giorgione. Kayak led me to gtahotels, which had the Giorgione for only $150/night. After checking the reviews on tripadvisor, I could tell this was a quality, well-located property -- and the price was much better than I could find for comparable hotels -- so I booked it. It was a good choice. Rick Steves calls the hotel "garish," and that is one of the few times I've seen Steves be completely off-base. It is a VERY nicely decorated Venitian hotel, with plenty of the glass that Venice is famous for. The courtyard and all the public rooms look very spiffy. I found the reception staff to be warm and helpful. And breakfast was much better than what you normally get in Italy, with plenty of meats, cheeses, fruit, bread, etc. -- and even bacon and eggs. I think rooms are very variable at this property, but most seem to be of at least 4-star quality. We had a charming room in the courtyard, with Venitian glass windows and antique furnishings. Very attractive. For the price paid, we really couldn't have asked for more. The location is outstanding: not hard to find, and right in the middle of things without being TOO crowded and touristy. If you can get a good deal here like we did, book it!

Reviews.Title: “great location and good standard”
Reviews.Author: 4ofusMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Great location although a bit pricey. Easy walking distance of the Rialto bridge etc. The internal courtyard was a nice feature as a cool resting place in the afternoon (altough we only used it the once as we were too busy taking in the sights). The rooms were quite small but quirky with columns and two mini bathrooms in our superior room. We took the advice of other reviewers and booked the better grade rooms so I'm not sure what the standard ones are like. The view from the window was a bit restricted - rooftops and a church tower but that's pretty typical of Venice I would say as everyone lives in close proximity. THe breakfasts were pretty ordinary. Limited buffet and the same everyday - kept running out of muesli! Overall, enjoyed our stay. Don't bother with the island boat trip though. We felt as though we were hoarded around like sheep. Get the vaporetto or taxi to Murano and give yourself time to browse and choose glass wear without the pressure of the boat leaving from the wharf in 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Galadriel_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for 4 nights August 07. found the hotel to be excellent in service,cleanliness and decor. Shower gel , soap etc in rooms. Safe in rooms, even umbrellas!! Reception staff friendly.Gave out a map of Venice with Hotel phone no. on to guests Breakfasts were plentiful with good coffee and tea self service. It is only 5mins walk from the Ca'D'oro vaporetto stop. (Take No 1 vaporetto from the Piazzale Roma) It is also only 10mins from Rialto Bridge You are able to leave your luggage safely stored on the day of your flight until you are ready to go to the airport . Note -do not eat at the restuarant with the outdoor seating in the middle of the square just down from the hotel,it is not good.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: europe2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in August 2006, the hotel is wonderful. The brunch each day was fresh and plentiful. The location was great, within easy walking distance to everything. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find.”
Reviews.Author: TillyAnn4
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location. Rooms and public areas were very nicely furnished. Beautiful relaxing terrace where breakfast was served. Staff very helpful and friendly. If you want a really nice elegant hotel without all the 5* fuss, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Terrikeith1030
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Wonderful Hotel Giorgione in Venice during our 3-stop tour of Italy 2 years ago. It was just perfect! The hotel is absolutly BEAUTIFUL and located in a great spot - not too close to the tourist attractions, but not too far that you have a long walk to see the sites. Its also close to the water taxi stop so you do not have a far walk with your luggage. The entire time we were in Venice it was raining but we didnt mind walking around with the large umbrellas the hotel provided for us. When we first arrived, my luggage didnt arrive with me. The hotel was kind enough to call the Airline and arrange for its delivery - which happened to come the night before I was to depart. The hotel serves a nice breakfast in their courtyard. And the rooms were spacious and pretty! There are several lounges in the lobby as well as internet access. I would definalty reccommend staying here if you are in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: SLMLeeds
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Giorgione in July this year with a girl friend, I agree with the previous review, the address given on the website we booked through [--] was confusing and we ended up getting of the water bus at Rialto bridge, walking over the bridge (with 13 pound suitcases) only to find it was on the other side!! And it was HOT. For reference, Ca d'Oro is closer. We stayed in a twin bedroom on the second floor (265 if memory serves), it was small but well appointed with plenty of storage space. There is free air-con in the room which was nice on an evening. Rialto Bridge only 2 mins away and St Marks Square in walking distance, the receptionist said it was a 20 min walk but we found a short cut of only 8 or so mins (although I can't remember it now!). The staff were very courteous and helpful, the latest we got back was 1am and there was a night receptionist for entry and keys. Breakfast was a typical Continental affair but plentiful. Afternoon tea (served by the decorative pool from 2-5) was a lovely touch and just what we needed after a hot day of sightseeing. The location was great, I'm glad we didn't stay in St Marks Square as it was way cheaper and we explored more of the city. We went for a friends wedding (which was beautiful), if you are going for the same reason the Town Hall is just by Rialto Bridge and to the left. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel, a little hard to find without directions”
Reviews.Author: sunnylagirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Giorgione with three friends in June during our tour of Europe. We arrived by train and didn't have exact directions to the hotel - just the location. So after some difficulty we found it. For future travelers arriving by train - take the number 1 vaparetto, exit Ca d'Oro, when you get off walk to the main street which is Strada Nova and hang a right. Walk to the very end where you will come to a small square (see my photo of the square so you can recognize it) and hang a left. You will see the Giorgione about 50 yards ahead with a big G on the side of the building. The hotel is very nice - a bit antiquated but clean. The staff is very helpful and we never had to wait long for anything we asked for (good, considering our hairdryer in the room was not working - someone was dispatched immediately and fixed it) be it pillows or maintenance. There is a very small elevator and the hotel has porters which is helpful. We were in room 307 when we stayed and were off main streets so the noise was minimal. Our window looked down into the hotel courtyard. To the right of our window was what looked like a lovely terrace but sadly it is only for the two rooms connected to it to use even though there was an exit door off the hallway. The rooms looked very old, but the beds were pretty comfortable - and as other travelers have stated - european beds in general tend to be too hard or too soft. Our room had an upstairs loft with beds pushed together to make a queen and a daybed/couch downstairs. The bathroom was large enough for 3 girls to use without crawling over each other but sink space was minimal. The air conditioning worked fine for us and you definitely need air conditioning as it is HOT in Venice in June. Also, I would recommend bug repellent - there are some mosquitos. They have free internet access off the lobby in the same room as the pool table (a nice touch). The breakfast was good, more American style than most continental breakfasts with eggs, meats, pastries, fruit, cereal, juices, coffee, etc. The hotel is indeed a 5 minute walk to the Rialto and 15 minutes to St Marks (thank you previous reviewers) and you can actually catch a gondolier not 3 minutes from the hotel. A couple of things about Venice in general that don't have to do with the hotel: There is an AMAZING restaurant on Strada Nova about 10 minutes from the hotel called Pasqualigo that serves the best Frutti di Mari dish EVER and the staff is wonderful. In regards to Harry's Bar (hangout of Hemingway and home to the original bellini) take your credit card with you - this place is NOT cheap. One small bellini will cost you 15 Euros. The bar downstairs is good for having A drink, if you decide to have lunch you will be blown away by the costs. A lunch risotto is approximately 65 Euros ($90) and a piece of chocolate cake is 29 Euros - but hey, you're going for the experience right? The other thing is - definitely take a gondola ride - it's absolutely worth it. It costs around 80 Euros for 45 minutes and take a bottle of wine with you. Many people don't realize you can do that. You can buy them at any restaurant or bar around town and they will uncork it for you at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luibelfast
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to venice and we were not disappointed. The hotel was as described in a quiet area but we found venice quite a quiet place after 11.00pm anyway. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was beautiful inside. It was lovely to sit by the decorative pool, enjoying a drink whilst listening to relaxing operatic music which played gently in the background. Finding our way around was a little tricky at first but people are very willing to point you in the right direction. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Venice”
Reviews.Author: EKKColorado
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel tucked away in a quiet part of Venice. About a 10 minute walk from the Ca D'Oro stop (make sure you go towards the Lido on the Vaporetto from the train station, or else they make you get off at the other end.). Thanks to the trip advisor member who wrote in directions! Incredible decorations, with Murano glass chandeliers everywhere and Capodimonte flower arrangements. Not a place for young kids, though, if they run around alot and you're worried about breakage. Very full breakfast with real coffee, served in beautiful courtyard with pool (to look at, not swim in). Rooms are alittle delapidated, though, and beds, as usual for Italy are hard and uncomfortable. Bathrooms are small and could be updated. It was clean, though, and friendly staff. The bartender was very nice, and we trained him how to make martinis. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “walls are thin! be warned”
Reviews.Author: laurainnewyork2004
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel and great position however the room walls are VERY thin and we had the unfortune of having 2 teenage girls (from a school party from USA, the hotel assured me that they usually don't accept school trips) sleeping in the room next door, needless to say we were kept awake the whole night. Could hear conversations -word for word / hair dryers / suitcases being unzipped etc etc. I mentioned it to reception, who couldn't move us as they were fully booked and said it is an 'ancient building' I was quite disappointed from this aspect but otherwise very happy with the hotel. Advice don't request room 101.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: clbz
Reviews.Content: 300 euros for a Saturday night, May 12, 2007. At the time, that was about $403 USD. A very small room with a 13 inch t.v. on a small table, a desk, a closet sized for maybe 4 winter coats, two twin beds pushed together and made up as one large bed for the two of us. A window with a close-up view of rooftop tiles and gutterwork. A chocolate was on each of two pillows; that was nice. But on the desk nearby was a cellophane-wrapped 3-pack of blue tablets marked "Raid." We scanned the (stained, cracked) walls and floor for cockroaches; saw none. Thankfully. Shuddered to think that someone unfamiliar with "Raid" might've thought it candy ... and eaten it. Entered the small bathroom: one sink, very minimal counterspace, tiny corner shower, no tub. The bathroom appeared clean, but smelled of urine. We would have preferred a clean bathroom over the chocolate; definitely, over the Raid pesticide. We left for a walk; stopped at the reception desk, and asked that the bathroom be re-cleaned. When we returned, it did not smell of urine. This meant that it was, indeed, Not clean when we first arrived. Sunday morning breakfast ambience was set to background music consisting of fine American compositions such as the theme song to The Pink Panther and various others of that ilk. Not exactly the "Italian" experience we were hoping for in Venice. Breakfast, itself, offered an assortment of sliced dry bread, thin-sliced ham, cheese, fruit, dry cereal, and ... what's this! ... a hot dish! Yep. Too hot, though: Burnt scrambled eggs sitting in a watery runoff. Thinking maybe the second batch would be better, we waited. Nope. Burnt again. The staff were friendly, though. Accommodated, without "attitude," our request to clean the bathroom. Gave helpful directions fairly patiently.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twelfers
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and well appointed hotel close to the Rialto Bridge but away from the crowds. The room we had was a little small but well equipped. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a treat. Venice is very expensive but the staff can recommend good value eating places. Our favourite was Casa Mia which was very close to the hotel: food was excellent and reasonably priced. It is off the tourist routes and used by the locals. Mr and Mrs B Prentis Eastbourne May 2007

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a great place!”
Reviews.Author: g12doc
Reviews.Content: Reviews are always subjective. Whether something is good or bad depends on expectations being met and previous experience of staying in hotels around the world. Star rating is supposed to give us some idea of what to expect but rarely does. So.... if you're from the US or form the UK (and probably elsewhere) this may say 4 stars in it's advertisments - but it isn't by US or UK standards. It is like other 4 star Italian hotels I've stayed in though - so if you're familiar with Italian star rating you'll know what to expect. This would be a 3 star hotel by my estimation - but that sounds overly negative. We found the hotel easily, were given the smallest room in the hotel (and none of them were huge!), enjoyed standard Italian breakfast fare (they don't go in for breakfasts much in Italian hotels) and experienced better-than-normal service from the guys at the front desk who spoke fluent English. The courtyard was very pleasant and a welcome break fron the bustle of Venice. The rooms were clean, the air con doesn't come on till May so we were pretty uncomfortable until we got used to the heat. The bar was much cheaper than the bars in the main streets - worth bearing in mind. The location was just about perfect for accessing the whole area. If you took a water taxi (90 Euros) from the airport they drop you off 100 yards from the front door and takes about 25 minutes from the airport. If you get the public bus it's way cheaper (6 Euros) but you have to queue and it takes very much longer and drops you further away. The vaporetto stop was 200 meters away on the Grand Canal and the Number 1 takes you pretty much to all the useful places you might want to go. It's a little difficult to get tickets although theoretically you can get them on board no -one seemed that interested even when I waved money in front of them so transport can be very cheap - but you risk a 30 Euro fine if you get caught. Better to buy a 12 hour pass for 13 Euros and hop on and off at will. On balance, a lot of money for what you get but we had no complaints and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: franab
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful four day stay at this hotel. Excellant location and within walking distance of everything. We walked everywhere and the weather was fantastic so we saw Venice at its best. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and we really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were large and our two teenage daughters stayed in the room next door to us also had a great room. Our only grumbles were the rooms were very hot at night and even though it was early April we had to sleep with the windows open so it was a little noisy from the street below even late into the night. Breakfast was fine. All in all it was a very good hotel and served our purpose well.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Jnfr28
Reviews.Content: Out of all the hotels that we stayed in within Italy, this was by far our favorite. It has an old fashioned feeling with a grand staircase. No floor is the same. They have a large lounge area and even a pool table (which we used since it rained the entire time we were there). The breakfast was wonderful, and the HUGE venetian chandelier in the courtyard is amazing. Eat breakfast outside under the chandelier and watch the birds hop around. The rooms have venetian chandeliers and comfy beds. Small room compared to US standards, but still cozy. There are chairs for reading and watching tv. The only wierd thing is when you take a shower, half of the bathroom floor gets wet......don't let this discourage you from staying though. It is rather comical. Wonderful location, central to everything. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: AptosLeone
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Hotel Giorgione. It was clean, had a great staff, and was in an excellent location. Near the Rialto Bridge and an easy vapporeto station. Lots of resturants in the area and on the main drag, so lots of foot traffic. BUT, its about 100 yards for all of that so its quite, but still easy to get to. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: jkhl95
Reviews.Content: Our decision to stay at the Hotel Giorgione was based partly on the reviews posted here and other travel resources. Reviews cite the hotel's "charm," "warm reception," and "quiet location." These remarks are indeed correct. The hotel lobby and public spaces that Rick Steves may find "garish" are indeed a bit showy, but better defined as elegant. This elegance, however, did not necessarily carry over to our room. We stayed in the Junior Suite as a party of three. The room was adequately sized for three with sleeping for two in a large bed in a loft area, and a sofa that converts to a bed on the main level. The decor was quaint, but not impressive. Tall windows let in plenty of light and opened to a mostly-quiet street below. Though it was November, it was unusually warm and the windows helped keep the room cool through the day--but the loft got hot at night. Can't imagine what it's like in the middle of summer! The bathroom is plenty large. It includes a bidet and heated towel rack. The water pressure is good and gets plenty hot for showers. If you have small children, or prefer baths, there was a tub in our bathroom. The staff was helpful and pleasant. The front desk will recommend restaurants and even call them for you regarding a table. There is a decently-appointed bar that makes a nice place to start your night. The complimentary breakfast buffet is well-stocked with meats, cheeses, breads, cereals, and most everything you require for breakfast. The location is ideal for avoiding the crowds and noise. This makes for a bit more walking to get to the sites or transportation, but still close enough to all the shopping and dining you desire. Getting to the hotel is so easy. The ACTV ("water bus") from the airport is a bargain at only â‚¬6 one-way. Yes, it takes longer than a private taxi, but is a fraction of the cost. Get off at the Fond. Nuove stop. Turn to your right and take your first left (Salizzada dei Speccheiri). Follow this path straight, bearing just to the right at Terra di S.S. Apostoli. Turn right at Campo Larga dei Proverbi. In Google Maps/Earth just type 45 26.463N, 12 20.184E in the search box (click the satellite view, as the street view is not correct). Internet access is free in the lobby. There is also a billiards table. In the end, we were pleased with our experience. As to whether this hotel qualifies as a 4-star hotel, that's questionable. I would have given the Giorgione 5 stars except that the beds were very hard, and the rooms were a little drab. 4-1/2 stars for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Way exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: JimLyon
Reviews.Content: This place is like a dream. The service, the location, the room, the staff, the facilities. We stayed for 3 nights it was wonderful. I was a hero in my wife's eyes. We booked online and got a pretty reasonable rate. I have never had a better stay at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mckooken
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best spots for visiting Venice! You are a ten minute walk to St. Marks, a five minute walk to the Rialto Bridge, and a 10 minute walk to the vaporetto station to the outer islands. It is also convenient because it's not on a major or crowded vaporetto stop, the Ca d'oro. The rooms are quiet and comfortable. The bathrooms could be a little cleaner for a four star hotel, but they were fine. The price is a little high, but that's how it is in Venice. Everything is a little high. The buffet breakfast was delicious with hot items and a wide assortment of other good eats. Overall it's a good hotel, and if you are visiting Venice, you should try and find a place in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: draflac
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. The room was well appointed and the bathroom modern. Even a heated towel rack. The breakfast was generous and included eggs and bacon. The location in the Cannaregio area was out of the touristy area, but an easy walk to the main sights, and we only got lost once. We ate dinner at a nearby restaurant the Veeia Cavana. This was the best meal we had on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch comfort and charm at the Giorgione”
Reviews.Author: brianhh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Girorgione after friends recommended it, and we weren't disappointed. Rick Steves call the hotel "garish", which I just don't get. It's close to the Rialto but isn't right on one of the main thoroughfares. The staff was extremely helpful, and the rooms were charming. We loved the painted furniture and especially the Murano glass chandelier. The breakfast was genorous and served in a bueatiful dining room, and if the weather had been just a tad warmer, we'd have been able to enjoy it in the lovely courtyard. One nice bonus is that they have a computer with free internet access right off the lobby, allowing us to check in on our email without having to find and pay for an internet cafe. The one drawback to our room was that it was over the hotel's restaurant, so there was some noise in the evenings. It looked like there were only a few rooms that would have this problem, so if you plan on turning in early, be sure and ask for a room that isn't over the restaurant. Speaking of the restaurant, we tried it but wouldn't recommend it. It's overpriced, the Trattoria da Beppi just around the corner had better food at better prices.

Reviews.Title: “Almost as good as our last visit”
Reviews.Author: Lexma90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Giorgione two years ago, and like its location in the Cannaregio. The staff was still helpful, the breakfast area still lovely, the location still good, though for people who aren't big walkers, the 20-minute walk to San Marco might be an issue. I love the Cannaregio and the lovely little pasticerria down the street. Our room this time, however, was much smaller than previously. It did have a nice view over the courtyard, though. I find the hotel easy to locate, and I have a very bad sense of direction. Also, for any runners, the hotel is a good location for that, as it's easy to run down the Strada Nuova (just down the street from the hotel) and parallel streets without getting lost. We will probably still here again on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CrazyHiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Giorgione from 8/29 to 9/1. I was a little worried about finding the hotel in the narrow windy streets of Venice, but it was very easy to find. You can see the hotel from the piazza at Campo di S.S. Apostoli if you look to your left after you reach the piazza from the Caâ€™dâ€™Oro stop. One of the pictures Iâ€™ve attached is this view. We reserved a standard double room for 100 euro a night on their website, but they must have upgraded us because we ended up with a junior loft room. The room was huge, very nice, and was always clean. The carpeting was a little old and could be replaced. The bathroom was very large with a bathtub and double sinks. It is the largest bathroom Iâ€™ve seen in all the three and four star hotels Iâ€™ve stayed in Europe. The one downside to the bathroom is that it could take up to 10 minutes to get any warm water in the shower. The cost of breakfast was included in the cost of the room so we had it everyday. The breakfast was one of the worst we had during our two weeks in Italy. The assortment of food was good, but the â€œhotâ€� food was lukewarm or cold, and the coffee (American drip-brewed) was also lukewarm or cold. The morning we checked out we had breakfast the minute they opened and the coffee and food were finally hot. The other mornings we would typically get down there 30-60 minutes after they opened. The hotel staff was very nice and friendly, and while we donâ€™t expect everyone to speak English, their English was very good. We would stay here again on a return trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Serval
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double room (one bed) for four nights in August at 110 Euro a night inlcuding tax, services and buffet breakfast. I booked throught the hotel's web site. The room was small but comfortable. The shower was a bit cramped, but I think we had one of the smaller rooms. The breakfast was good with a nice selection of breads, cereals, cold meats and cheeses, and fruit. We enjoyed eating in the courtyard next to the fountain. The staff at the reception desk was always pleasant and helpful and everyone spoke English. We ate dinner at the restaurant that goes by the same name as the hotel just a few feet from the hotel and had good meals.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Hadassah28
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and we had no idea what to expect, so it is with great pleasure that I write this review. The Hotel Giorgione was absolutely pleasant and charming. Here's our impressions: 1) Front staff very friendly and helpful - at all hours. 2) Close proximity to Murano Island, Rialto Bridge, Gondola rides and the water taxi for the airport. 3) Complimentary water taxi to Murano Island for private glass blowing demonstration and tour of glass company 4) Internet limited availability but its FREE 5) Ask for a converter; they have some on hand 6) Afternoon tea and cookies is a nice touch. 7) Garden courtyard with fountain and piped-in music 8) Fountain pool delightful with its pieces of colored glass and water lilies. 9) Breakfast room is gorgeous! Breakfast foods - lots and nice variety. 10) Our room impeccably clean and orderly 11) Bidet and hose shower very welcome 12) Aesthetically very beautiful small hotel with huge Murano glass chandeliers and wall sconces - gorgeous. 13) Front desk staff - good English 14) Sitting room - gorgeous and comfortable 15) Nice little public square just down the alleyway 16) Lots of shops, food shops, fresh fruit and vegetable market, souvenir shops, gelateria, wine, bakery, grocery mart. All very nearby. Downside: Room very cold with air conditioning but either that or muggy air. Our room was right near a speaker in the courtyard. We had to complain about the volume at night, but they turned it down immediately. Bad Note: Nothing to do with the Giorgione but a scam run by a restaurant a short way from the Giorgione. Be very careful as the price shown in the menu is by weight. We ate a piece of fish that we thought would be 7 Euros...imagine our surprise when the bill came to 35 Euros per plate.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic & wonderful”
Reviews.Author: GemR
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 days in Venice with my wonderful husband. Still in our first year of marriage we wanted to visit the most romantic city in the world. After checking Trip Advisor I booked direct with the hotel on-line as they offered 4 nights for the price of 3. As if being in Venice wasn't amazing enough the Giorgione Hotel was fabulous. We had the least luxurious room however it was so romantic and comfortable and I can only imagine how great the more expensive rooms are. The staff were attentive, warm and friendly. The courtyard was stunning and a great place to relax over 5 o'clock tea and biscuits away from the bustle of the Venetian streets. Breakfast was delicious and in the local area we found several restaurants and bars that were very reasonable. We expected the trip to cost a fortune but we were pleasantly suprised. St Mark's square is easily within a 10-15 minute walk away. If you want a hotel for a truly romantic break and won't break the bank then this hotel is just what you are looking for. I can't wait until we can go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Operation”
Reviews.Author: KINGOFOMAHA
Reviews.Content: Absolutely excellent staff, great rooms and excellent breakfast included daily. Lots of local information provided by the staff with English explanations that were comprehensive. You will feel part of their hotel and they will become part of your trip. Facilities were equal to our first Italian hotel, a Four Star. You will not regret staying at this hotel. Venice itself is expensive but this hotel gives mid week discounts on Expedia of $25 a day. It was a real pleasure to stay here and say hello to "Enrica" at the front Reception, she is the greatest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent would recommend A+++”
Reviews.Author: Chris6044
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Girogione for 3 nights as part of a two week Honeymoon in Italy and couldn't have hoped for a better place to stay. We had a water taxi in from Marco Polo aiport which took 20 mins got off it and walked for 2 mins to the hotel. The hotel is decorated really well and the staff are so friendly and can speak many languages. It is 5 mins from Rialto bridge and 20 mins from St Marks squares so is ideal for exploring. It is lovely and quiet at night and the rooms are well air-conditioned. Breakfast as with all the hotel we stayed at in Italy is a continental style buffet and has plenty of variation and everything is fresh. I would have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone and it is very well priced too. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Resonable priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birmingham_Lad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located for everything & the staff are very helpful. The breakfast is very good & includes a large selection to help you fill up before a day of walking. I would recommend this hotel to future travellers to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing place and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatyKay
Reviews.Content: We wanted a nice break away from the kids and as Venice was on our list of must see's, decided we would give it a try. Did a little research on the hotels and after reading comments through trip advisor and expedia decided the Giorgione was for us - we weren't disappointed! We stayed 3 nights but could have done with 4 really. The hotel is conveniently located in a quite area behind the Apostioli Church (currently under renovation as is most of Venice but still nice to see). Close to the Vaporetto Ca d'Ore - (suggest you buy a tourist 3 day ticket 25Euro - hop on and off as you want). There are restaurants all around so you wont go hungry and you can eat as cheaply or as expensively as you wish although I would avoid the tourist menus, although we didn't have them some others we chatted to had and weren't impressed. There are several gondola stations near by, expect to pay 100Euro's for a 50minute ride, not cheap but they also act as mini tours, the one we had took us on to the Grand Canal and around the little back allies and made sure we saw all the palaces and places of interest. Would also recommend you make time for a trip to Burano (no1 vaparetto from Ca d'Ore stop) very pretty. Expect to get lost ! but enjoy - it really is a joy finding your way around our guide map was well used. The service in the hotel was excellent - incredibly friendly with a lovely atmosphere. Our room was on the top floor and on two levels with a sitting room as you walked in then the bedroom and bathroom facilities above - very quaint. Our room was well decorated and fitted out - 2 TV's fridge etc. If anything it lacked tea/coffee making facilities but the view over the roof tops made up for that. The continental breakfast was more than adequate and should have something for all tastes. A small bar leads onto a garden terrace with water feature where tea/coffee and biscuits are served free of charge in the afternoon - a nice touch. Also free internet and pool table in the lobby area if you want to use them. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this reasonably priced hotel in November 2004 and Nov. 2005. Both times the staff was great, the breakfasts were delicious and were served in a lovely setting. The second time we had a junior suite, which worked well. Will stay here the next time I'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jenialexis
Reviews.Content: just came back from enchanting Venice - what an amazing city....it was almost impossible to leave....its simply magical.... we stayed at Hotel Giorgione - nice place....with an exception of a very average room with an slightly outdate decor, i am pleased with the hotel....great location, fairly easy to get to (Ca D'Oro stop on Vaporetto), gorgeous gem of a garden with a complimentaly afternoon tea every day (truly a great surprise) and a huge, delicious breakfast. The staff was very nice and helpful and the internet service is included in all, i would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone enjoy your next visit to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Durango83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to Italy and our first stop was Venice. The Hotel Giorgione was fabulous! The place itself was very charming and clean and the staff was extremely polite and helpful. They served a delicious breakfast every morning, which was just what we needed to get us started on our busy day of sightseeing. We enjoyed relaxing in the courtyard with a cocktail in the afternoon before heading out for the evening. Very close to everything, especially the Rialto Bridge. I would highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay here on our next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Even better the second time around”
Reviews.Author: Oneomaniac
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six night stay in Venice and our stay at the Giorgione Hotel was a tremendous pleasure! I had stayed here in May 2001, and so when the search began for a second visit to Venice, I kept my previous stay here in mind, but I did want to search other options. When I weighed location and price, I decided to go with my gut and reserved our stay at a tried and true hotel. What an excellent decision!! Il Giorgione has remained absolutely pristine, gracious and a gem in a delightful little piazza close to everything you'd want. It is located right off Strada Nuova, a very bustling main thoroughfare and yet in the Campo SS Apostoli you are enveloped in everyday Venetian life, with a true neighborhood feeling. Easy to find (CÃ¡ D'oro Vaporetto stop), 15 minute walk to Piazza San Marco, 5 minutes to Rialto, and yet quiet enough at night to relax and stroll in peace. The room was immaculate, spacious and flooded with light from windows facing a small canal and a flower laden side street. The front desk was staffed with really pleasant, professional people who always had time for questions and good recommendations. (There is a wonderful,repeat wonderful, restaurant just down the street and around a corner called La Vechia Cava.) Breakfast served either in the courtyard by a lovely fountain or inside in a very pretty room, was really nice with the typical buffet spread, yet each morning there were one or two selections that were different.The lobby is very prettily decorated in high Venetian fashion with alot of comfortable seating affording a pleasant spot to wind down and have a drink, coffee, etc. I highly recommend this hotel, would not hesitate to return as I consider it to have enhanced my visit to this magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Spot in Venice”
Reviews.Author: avalente
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giorgone on our recent stay in Venice. The staff was very helpful with all our dinner reservation requests and the questions we had about Venice. A beautiful courtyard in the center which is great place to enjoy the ample breakfast the hotel provides. Our room was a good size, especially for Venice, with good A/C and water, which is not always a given in Italy. Great locale, close to the Rialto bridge, but on a queit side street. We would defiantley stay again if we went back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmoranville
Reviews.Content: We had the least expensive room in the hotel. It was plenty big and had a view of the Courtyard. The furnishings were pretty and we had a chandilier over the bed. The lobby is beautiful. The breakfast is adequate and the hotel itself is what you would hope for in Venice. Very "Venetian!" It is an easy and picturesque walk to St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. It was very close to great restaurants and fun shopping. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure of Venice”
Reviews.Author: FHNottingham
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a four night stay in the Giorgione for a special birthday treat and what a super hidden treasure it turned out to be. Recommended by a friend and having read all the trip reviews before we booked we thought we knew what to expect - but its better when you get there! Forget the american hangups on room sizes - why do you want big rooms in Venice? Everywhere in the hotel is clean, staff are very friendly and helpful, breakfast good, the restaurant next door is superb and yes the vaporetta stop is five minutes away. The only thing I can't agree with is the 15 -20 min walk to San Marc Plaza - make it last 40 minutes and explore the real Venice off the beaten track - shops are super, streets clean and windy and full of historical value and the ambience is so much better when you hit the big Plazas. Would we go back to this little gem? Most definitely - we brits love our tiffin and how nice to rest your tired feet pre dinner than by having tea and bics in the quiet garden area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sae56
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reviewing guide books and this web site and was not disappointed. Hotel was excellent in every respect. The service and staff were superb. Location is ideal in what is a small city. Breakfast buffet was more than adequate and the public areas were very comfortable and beautifully decorated. We would certainly return to this hotel if we go back to Venice. We found the city of Venice to be a unique destination, very different from any other. The traffic free streets and canals providing routes around the city take you back in time. The absence of traffic lets you hear the birds and the church bells right in the city centre. Once you get away from St Mark's square, the streets, museums and churches were very quiet at the beginning of April.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Hairybiker777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights at the end of March 2006, having booked through Expedia for c.60GBP per night. We were extremely happy with the hotel and have no complaints at all. We found the staff to be welcoming, helpful and efficient - we were shown around the hotel and to our room by a polite young lady. Extra pillows arrived only minutes after requesting them. Breakfast was included in the deal and was very nice; all the usual fruit, cereals, croissants etc as well as come nice hot food (bacon and egg) too. Only one minor disappointment - you have to pay extra for fruit juice. Never mind, the breakfast room is done out beautifully and the food was of a high standard. The reception, lounge and breakfast rooms are all very pleasant. The billiards table is free, as is the internet access. There's a nice lounge where complimentary tea, coffee and biscuits are available in the afternoon. There's a small courtyard too. Our room, although quite small, was fine for a short break; the bed was a little hard but everything was clean, and the wardrobe contained a safe which was free to use. The location of the hotel is great; two minutes walk from the Ca d'oro vaporetto station on the grand canal. It's maybe 10 or 15 mins walk to Piazza San Marco. The hotel is tucked away up a side street where it's nice and quiet. There are plenty of restaurants close by. To be honest, Venice is so small that nowhere is *too* far away... I can't fault it for the money. Sure, there are fancier hotels in Venice, but you pay through the nose for them. The Giorgione is clean, safe, well-positioned and offers good value for money. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: pt-travel
Reviews.Content: Picked the hotel using expedia results and would agree. Good value, friendly staff with afternoon tea and coffee available every day. About 20 minutes walk from san marco, but what a great walk it is. River buses are convenient. Rooms are smallish, but well furnished and decorated and very clean. The only thing I would have liked is tea/coffee facilities in the rooms. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bysshe98
Reviews.Content: What a great find this is. (Ignore the review of 18 August). We had 2 rooms on the very top floor with private little terraces amongst the roof tops ! All rooms in Italian hotels are small, so if you are an American looking for size rather than quality then this is not for you. Every one of the staff that we encountered had a cheery smile and went out of their way to help. Free PC in the lobby with snooker table and small bar with a delightful Indian barman. Breakfast in the courtyard next to the water feature and fountain in the sun was as romantic as it can get. Everywhere in Venice is hard to find the first time that you try so dont be put off....great location a minute or two from the Rialto bridge and a slow picturesque 10-15 minute amble to St Marks square. All you rock-an-rollers out there be warned...everyone in Venice is asleep by 10pm !..unlike France or Spain when people dont even think about going out until 10pm and midnight is not an unusual time to sit down for dinner....even with kids! A superb hotel in one of the most magical cities on earth...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Romantic Truly Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our choice. This is a beautiful hotel great atmosphere. There is a lovely garden room where you can have tea and cookies in the afternoon and rest after a day of sightseeing. The breakfast is simple but plentiful. If you follow the directions the hotel gives it is very easy to find the hotel. It is away from the crowds but within walking distance to every attraction. If you come to Venice the object is to walk, you can't get lost and it is easy to get around. We would stay there again if we came back.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this place”
Reviews.Author: charleshay
Reviews.Content: Getting to this hotel is a bit of a puzzle, but get off at the Ca d'Oro, turn right at the end of the alley, follow the street until you reach the second big street, make a hard left and the hotel is right in front of you. The rooms are small by American standards, but well appointed, and the bath is excellent. Great breakfast room with a courtyard, and there is a lounge and a bar. Breakfast is good and there are even scrambled eggs and English bacon. The wait staff will gladly brew you a capucchino if you ask. The restaurant next door is popular with the locals and the waiters are a joy. The neighborhood is wonderful for wandering with lots of dark alleys and small canals. I won't waste your time with suggestions for Venice, get lost, enjoy, explore. Venice is a banquet of the unexpected. One honest word, however, there is at times the smell of raw sewage about the place. The staff is always running about spritzing the place and the rooms come with plug-in air freshners. But...in the morning, you are awakened by the bells of the nearby convent school, and the songs of children as they walk to class. Thoroughly charming.

Reviews.Title: “ok if neighbours are ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: good middle class hotel in venice. central, good area to explore. close to Canale Grande and to restaurants. 20 minutes walk to Piazza San Marco: the right distance for staying out of the heavy tourist hassle; north of it there is a quiet and interesting area. but not very authentic inside the hotel. clean, small rooms, thin walls. staff rather cool in the beginning, but friendly and helpful if you make a little effort too. internet in the lobby. breakfast ok, but not really italian style either. international clients from everywhere. not far from vaporetto station, which is good get there the first time and to get around while stying in Venice. I can recommend it - if your neighbours let you sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again, but don't drink the milk!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during our honeymoon trip to Italy this month. We loved the location which is convenient but yet still set back in a neighborhood (i.e. less-touristy) corner. We had a room they called a suite, which was nice but not really a suite by my definition. It was a small two level room with the bed upstairs in a loft set-up. The balcony complete with a table and chairs was the room's best feature and perfect to sit and drink a bottle of wine after a long day. As several have mentioned, the breakfast buffet was disappointing. It's very European - cold meats, cheeses, and hard bread - along with cereal and fruit. As we found many places, the milk was served room temperature. Unfortunately however, it was also served soured our 2nd morning - YUCK!! So, warning to all - Beware of the milk!!! All in all, we would definitely stay here again sans breakfast. The free internet in the lobby was a nice bonus and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: junglemarine
Reviews.Content: I am planning a return to Venice so while browsing this site I was surprised to read the August 18th review of this hotel where I stayed in 2002. To me, the location, off the beaten path, is a plus. Yes its a twenty minute walk to Piazza San Marco. So what! This is Venice, you walk everywhere and every where you walk you are in Venice. Just around the corner is a local supermarket serving one of the few remaining neighborhoods where Venetions actually live. Its also nice not to have to fight through the crowds to get into your hotel. The service was extremely warm and courteous and the food exellent. I think I just talked myself into a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After doing a little research, my friend gave me a list of hotels that she thought would be nice for our trip to Venice, one of which was the Hotel Giorgione. The reviews on Expedia were excellent, so I thought it was a good pick. I was wrong! Not only is the hotel quite far from the Piazza San Marco (I was aware of this as I had stayed in the Canareggio the last time I was in Venice) it was not terribly easy to find with the bad directions the Venetians gave us. Five minutes away! Close! No, it was more like at least 20 more minutes away and not close! The front desk staff was fairly helpful. One woman was extremely kind and helpful, the other was disinterested. The internet (one computer in the lobby) was very fast and free, which was a plus, but be prepared to wait a while if someone else is using it. The breakfast I found to be very yummy (fluffy eggs and bacon cooked just right - not burnt!) but lacking in fresh orange juice - sorry, only canned pineapple juice here! I would not go back again due to the location (it was a major ordeal to lug all of our stuff all around the city) but have to say the reviews were partially right, the staff can be nice, the breakfast was good enough, and the place is quaint. But be prepared for TINY rooms (the bathroom was bigger than the sleeping area) and a hotel that is more like a B&B, not even a 3 1/2 or 4 star. The pictures make the courtyard look larger and nicer than it is. It was sort of cute, but it was definitely in need of some renovation to make it look like it did in the pictures. One thing that saved the whole place was the bathroom had recently been redone and was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 9PM and were greeted by an extremely friendly face. We were shown to our rooms by a man that could not speak a word of English and we could not speak a word of Italian. However, we somehow communicated and were shown to our two Junior Suites. Since we expected our rooms to be smaller in Europe, we were not disappointed. We actually loved our room, 219, since it had two small bathrooms and was larger than our other junior suite in which our children stayed. Each day we were greeted with a smile and Bongiorno. We felt that the location was wonderful since it was off the beaten track and was within walking distance of everything, St Marks, Rialto Bridge, shops, restaurants, etc. We loved the quiet location after the many tourist that we encountered in all of the other locations. It was a breath of fresh air in a city that had so many summer tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every Euro”
Reviews.Author: FredPurdue
Reviews.Content: Everything is expensive in Venice, so we weren't shocked by the $300 a night expense. Clean, light, airy rooms. Substantial hot breakfast. Free internet access and a pool table. Helpful staff. And the location is ideal since it is less than ten minutes to the Grand Canal waterbus stop. Many restaurants in the area as well as shopping and a grocery. This was the most delightful hotel we stayed in during our month in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Georgione- Nice hotel off the beaten tourist track”
Reviews.Author: sseansully
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were a bit wary about staying at the Giorgione becuase of the mixed reviews on Tripadvisor, but the price was right (can't give an exact price because the stay was part of a complicated 3-country package) and some of the reviews made the hotel sound just OK. As it turned out, the hotel was much better than OK. Our room was good sized, especially for a European hotel, clean and comfortable. The hotel has a nice area for drinks and tea in a courtyard and offers a good (not great) breakfast, which was included in the price. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is about a 15 minute charming walk from St. Mark's and its hordes of tourists (hordes!!). We liked the location very much -- much more of a hometown Venice feel than a touristy environment. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Needless concern about Giorgione”
Reviews.Author: Netsuke
Reviews.Content: We were more than a little apprehensive about having booked this hotel having read the reviews but on the whole were very satisfied with our stay here. We had a junior suite overlooking the courtyard,opening windows in bedroom and bathroom which was a little cramped but adequate.Everthing was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpfull and the breakfast provided a good choice but it would have been improved if the fruit salad was fresh instead of tinned. The hotel was very quiet at night and it was interesting to be in an area which still has more local shops than tourist ones ,also several restuarants some expensive some not within 5 mins of hotel.Very close to Rialto and easy walk to St Marks.On a previous trip to Venice we stayed in a hotel which overlooked a canal and had typical Venetian-byzantine architecture very attractive but the room was tiny and the shower in a cupboard and the staff were very offhand, so we would definitely stay at the Giorgione again and recommend it to others.Maybe it is more like a good 3-star but this is Venice!

Reviews.Title: “an oasis from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Giogioni at the end of March, 2005. This was our second stay. Our first visit was during Carnivale two years ago. By the time we made our way from the train station thru the crowds, we almost exhaled out loud when we opened the door to tranquility. The hotel is one vaporetto stop from the Rialto bridge, Ca d'Or, and has it's own little neighborhood of shops and restaurants. The rooms are small but nice. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. Every day we asked their help with directions, making dinner reservations, how much we should expect to pay for a gondola ride, etc. I would suggest you take the vaporetto to Murano. The hotel offers a free boat, but then you are taken to an expensive glass showroom and a glass blowing demonstration. We save Venice for the end of our visits to Italy and feel very pampered at the Giorgioi, after days of catching trains and hectic sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Giorgione in December”
Reviews.Author: shartley
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this site, we were a little concern that the hotel we had been recommend by friends was going to be a turkey. We booked a superior room for three nights in early December. We arrived at night, walking through venice by the pale street lights, finding our way after asking directions. Our room was huge, with a massive bathroom (by hotel standards) and warm (it was a cold night in Venice) We were able to open the windows onto the street to be able to get a nice cool tempreture to sleep in. One of the great advantages of this hotel is that it is soooo quiet. Other friends who have been to Venice and stayed in hotels on the Grand Canal complained of the constant noise. We however had total quiet at night which is bliss. The area is not touristy at all, which we liked very much, and found some wonderful places to eat, along with the locals, which was just perfect. However, it was only a few minutes walk to San Marco through the maze of wonderful streets. I thought the hotel was great value for a 4 star hotel, it is not fancy, but a friendly family run place with helpful pleasant staff. I agree that the breakfast is not great, but to be honest I think it is more European than American so I can see why some folk might be a little disappointed Would I return?, well yes like a shot, but if you are looking for Venice glammour then this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “more fluff than stuff”
Reviews.Author: abrady120
Reviews.Content: To be fair, this is not the sort of accomodation we prefer (too many rooms, more like a real hotel than a quaint inn) but we traveled to Venice at the last minute and felt lucky to get the reservation. When I called, I was quoted a "special" last minute rate of 140 euros per night and given a confirmation number. We are seasoned travelers, but when we checked in I failed to verify the rate and on checkout, we were charged 180 euros per night. The desk clerk was very arrogant and told me it was impossible to get a room there for 140 euros and that I had misunderstood the price. He picked up the desk phone and was going to call someone to set me straight, but I just smiled and told him that was OK, no big deal. Since I had no printed confirmation, I thanked him and mentally calculated the price of that lesson learned. I was absolutely quoted 140 euros a night and the desk clerk most certainly had been through that drill before. Besides the rate problem, I felt this hotel was overpriced and more fluff than stuff. Our room was miniscule. The refrigerator was not working, the air was turned off, which shouldn't have mattered, but the mosquitos were bad and it was a very hot room. They had one computer for the internet and it was not working. I could not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed newlyweds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel on our honeymoon and had splashed out on a junior suite. It cost 400 euros per night - no small amount to newlyweds, and we were bitterly disappointed. The room was TINY. There was a miniscule lounge, which, once we opened out the suitcase, had no room to stand (there was nowhere else to put the case, and a pitifully small wardrobe). The bedroom and bathroom were similarly microscopic, and we spent our time falling over each other and our belongings. Breakfast was pretty poor. The highlights were orange squash and tinned fruit salad. We may have been spoilt by our previous hotel in Florence, the marvellous Palazzo Magnono Feroni, where we had a huge room and the staff fell over themselves to make us enjoy our stay, but the staff here just seemed bored, and every so slightly sneering. I am aware that good value is thin on the ground in Venice, but I'm sure there must be better than this. We fell in love with Venice, and will be returning. Safe to say, it will not be to the Giorgione.

Reviews.Title: “A very good value!”
Reviews.Author: Maizie3213
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here! The service was second to none, although the rooms were a bit on the small side. There is a lovely courtyard and breakfast room, where we enjoyed a better then average meal every morning. This hotel is in a perfect setting. We'd come again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: kktunnell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in late June. It was the largest hotel we had staying in during our 2 weeks in Italy. We found the rooms smallish, but entirely adequate. The breaksfasts were great and the outside breakfast area was beautiful. There was free internet access adjacent to the lobby, and a small bar. A free water taxi ride to Murano was included with our room. We just told them when we were ready to go and a staff member walked us to the canal stop. The staff were all very helpful and professional. Rooms had airconditioning and safes. Though it is not on the water, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb without doubt!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August 2004. It was superb!!! The staff were extremely friendly, rooms very clean and the breakfast really good with plenty to eat. There were 6 adults in our party and we all thought the same. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. It really lived up to its 4 star rating! It helped made our first visit to Venice truly magical.

HotelInfo.Name: Giorgione Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: SS. Apostoli 4587, 30131 Venice, Italy
